content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
												Tactical Intervention is a multiplayer FPS developed by Minh "Gooseman" Le who earlier co-developed counter-strike. This does seem like a good way to make a comeback but Tactical Intervention suffers some major drawbacks.The game itself seems just like a standard multiplayer FPS. You get a gun wich you then run around and shoot people in the head with and eventually get shot in the head yourself. Seems fairly simple right? But the game got these nice little small details wich varies from using a fire extinguisher to put up a smoke wall to being able to roll away from explosions and thereby prevent taking damage. This is according to myself the only positive point of the entire game.The gameplay is also one of the worst of modern day FPS games. It's not that it's bad but it's just nothing special.And don't get me started on the animations. Everyone looks like crabs when they walk around! And with just around 500 ppl in game at the time this is written? The game has been out for less than a year and the community is alredy dying out.As a F2P title the game functions as a good example of a Pay 2 Win game (P2W). This means that the people who pay for stuff in the game (be it a more powerful weapon or even dogs) can totally dominate the people who don't. So someone who is far more skilled may get totally rolled over by someone far less skilled just because the far lessed skilled guy has put more money on the table.PROS+ Good ideas that later FPS games may improve+ Better than COD+ So bad it's funny if you're in the right moodCONS- P2W- Laughable animations- The community is barely aliveOVERALL SCORE 32/100

number of helpful: 351 of 434 people (81%) found this review helpful98 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												Tactical Intervention.Not tactical at all.So this game is... a bit weird. It's not good... but it ain't bad either. It DOES have some potential to be a good game, but... it's not going that way... much.And it's not tactical at all, it's a free-to-play "Counter-Strike" ... "styled" ... game... ? It's not a slow game, it's the opposite actually - it's a bit fast, but not CoD fast or Quake fast.Right off the bat I'll say that the shooting is really weird, it's jerky and awkward to get used to. The network part of the game is horrendously bad, and there's some optimisation issues (it's Source engine for ♥♥♥♥'s sake, how can you mess up that?)But it's still VERY ♥♥♥♥ING FUNThe best mode in the entire game must be the VIP Car Escort, which is a car chase on a few maps (so far 3 exist), which are pretty big, and you just have to drive forward.Driving isn't as simple as it sounds, the handling is unlike any other game with cars. It's a bit hard to learn but it comes fast.So while you drive, you occassionally stumble upon green boxes, which can heal you, your passengers, repair your ride a bit (dunno about that one actually) and have a surprise weapon like a grenade launcher or RPG which is a round changer most of the time.It's unfriendly to new people, because there's a bunch of menu options and sections where you just get confused how everything works, and most of the mechanics are explained through VERY simple tips during the loading screen. The best way to learn is in practice.Get a friend or two or a pack of them, grab some alcohol (optional), go with your friends on one team and play the game. It can be enjoyable.tl;dr:+- weird shooting, can♥♥♥♥♥♥you off+- weird driving, makes you laugh sometimes+ car chase best mode- borderline if not crossing the pay2win line- unbalanced weaponry--- heavy armor ffs nerf that♥♥♥♥♥♥br>++ awkwardly fun with friends+++ gore- network stuff

number of helpful: 324 of 422 people (77%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2013
												*The game is now released so this review might not be fitting anymore, but of what ive seen of it since its release is that its only gotten better in my opinion.*First id like to say that this game is currently in Open Beta state, so dont expect much from it.Ive got to say i actually really like this game, it has lots of potentional. It has this Counter-Strike feel to it, which i love, such as: No ADS (Aim Down Sights), Recoil and more. I like it because im a huge fan of the Counter-Strike series and just VALVe games in general, theyre genius. I like the ideas they have put into this game like the gamemode where you can drive a car. The game doesnt have amazing graphics, but i dont expect more from a F2P FPS (Free to Play - First Person Shooter) game really.The first time i played it, it was quite confusing, but it didnt take long before i had a ton of fun in it.A thing i also like about this game is thats its not Pay2Win, even though you can use real money to get kind of better weapons, it doesnt ruin the game at all. I, myself, use the P90, and ive bought it for lifetime for in-game money, and it works perfectly fine against AK's and M4's even, its pretty well balanced.All in all i think id rate it a 8/10. <- Open beta rating.*I will now change this to a 9/10 because of full release.*End thoughts:The gamemode with the cars could use some polishing, it can be quite glitchy driving into each other and stuff, but im not sure if it can get fixed, its still fun though.*This has been more polished now and works better.*The recoil when you spray could be a lot better, because it seems like you deal 0% damage if you spray, even when it says i hit the enemy when i spray, i dont get assist if somebody else kills him. Even though you dont spray in a game like this, it still needs to get improved. If you think the recoil is bad and the game is hard, its just because you need to train, its like Counter-Strike, you need to double-tap instead of spraying.*The spraying and dealing no damage thing seems to have been improved, but its still there in som cases, be aware of this.*But well, awesome game in my opinion, give it a try and if you dont like it after the first 5 minutes, play some more, it will get better. But if it doesnt, i guess its not the game for you. Its F2P (Free to Play) and you dont have to use actual money to play it. Its also made in the Source Engine, which is my favourite engine, love it.Nice game, highly recommended.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												The game is okay in some sense, the only trouble i have with it is that it is not super obvious which servers have high level OP players and others that have low level players.It can ruin your experiance if you join a game and the enemy team has like possibly 3 players in lvl 30 and they do all the killing whilst the low levels on that team just dmg you and then the OP ones finish you off or they kill you solo, as they are wearing bulletproof helmets and body armor that well protects them too well, the starter weapons are alright but the best thing to do first is buy one guy permanantly and possibly a new pistol, i went with the MP5 the pistol though i forgot the name, game is slightly easy to learn but hard it CAN be tactical if you well work with a friend and crouch walk silencing your footsteps and leaning around corners before entering an area, the only major downside is if the map is close quarters expect A LOT of shotgunners, as they will and always will 1 shot you no matter what so if you hear footsteps (if you are deaf or not) then be sure to fire first as if someone sprints or opens fire they will appear as a red dot on your circle like radar, very handy though as it will well...be your "wallhack" you could say so whenever someone sprints towards your direction you can snap at the location of the dot and be instantly ready since everyone in this game sprints like a mad man on drugs.The thing i dislike the most about this game is that the starter weapons are not that useful against someone who has all the gear already by buying items, like the m1 is terrible and it's best to stick with the skorpion the shotgun is alright but sometimes it's bad in all ways, i majorly dislike the default starter sniper as well it's too shakey i assume the sniper everyone uses the ASO or whatever has no breathing on it and it's 100% steady all the time as the sniper will 1 shot you like the AWP in Counter Strike, it's very hard to get used to the recoil sometimes so when playing TDM and you join quickly in the warm up, try out the recoil BEFORE you get into a fight so you know how many shots you can fire before going sky high with recoil.The propane tanks and such in this game are slightly useful as the fire extinguisher will be a free and easy smoke screen and flashbang somewhat, so if you assume enemy is around corner you can make your own smoke screen cover then if he runs through it you can "flashbang" him with the smoke, it's also useful if you shoot it near an enemy whom has not used their fire extinguisher to i assume kill them or blind them, the propane tanks though i dislike slightly as all they do is spin around and damage you slightly and knock you back, i assumed they would blow up after a certain time limit but that's up to those gas cans which i assume you cannot move at all and can only kick.The hostages in this game are a pain though as when playing the hostage capture mode on round 1, you have to capture all hostages or save them to win or just kill the enemy team which everyone does, losing EXP for killing a civi is however dumb though as in the car chase modes it will happen often due to it being hard to drive somewhat, i also dislike how it's hard to keep track of hostages since they can wander away and the T's are on a limited playing field while CT's however can roam around freely, if this was CS everyone can move around freely and not be restricted, i would like however if you could see the sharpshooters that will kill you if you try to leave the area, then if you kill them you can roam around freely.I however dislike the killstreak items as it will be impossible to get the m249 or rpg even the grenade launcher, all a rushing player could get is a flashbang and tear gas before he/she dies, yet tactical players will be able to get almost everything in the special rewards area, the kill streaks however would be useful on a FFA not a TDM, TDM is very very annoying since you could join servers where is up to rank 9 or lower and a rank 3 or 6 could have good gear since they bought it and it will be slightly unfair, i would like though that if a player has body armour they could have some what of a unique model or something.The problem this game has is that you possibly "gain" accuracy if you stay with allies yet everyone rushes and stays away from each other like this is CS, yet it is not and is a much harder or easier version of CS so they only survive for about a second or two, though the accuracy gain is not super visible i assume that the 3 little bars on your crosshair mean your accuracy gain, so it must mean that it gets majorly worse as you stick with allies or something since it feels like that, i must say though if it is a gain then it should be gained by 5% so if you and a friend stay close you gain 5% accuracy boost, the larger the squad the better which will greatly help let's say a sniper or a player with an LMG.The rolling in this game is sort of useful if you are crouching when facing an enemy and roll away or back, i assume they think you are dead and stop firing for a second or they miss all their shots due to bad connection or something, it can be useful if you use it right, never attempt to sprint away when getting shot as it means wasting stamina and insta death, it is much faster and easier to roll, though you will not see it happen very often in this game since everyone sprints, dies, see's nade sprints away instead of rolling since it reduces damage taken.Blind fire however is not useful at all since if the weapon viewmodel is aiming at let's say the table that you are hiding behind you wont shoot over it and will hit the table instead, this feature however gets unused A LOT.The voice commands in this game are not very...useful the reason is because they are all icons, for taking fire it's a man on fire which does not make sense at all, if this was CS:GO or CSS you would have much more voice commands and more options to command the team, in this game you can only say, medic, follow, roger, you lead, under fire, cover me and that's it. not very useful if you dislike typing to command a team, i also must say i dislike how the characters don't have unique voices like CT's should have a serious swat voiced person whilst T's have a somewhat i assume inexperienced terrorist voice or trained terrorist, something along those lines as the voice lines are always the same guy on either team.The auto voice command whenever a player is low on hp is very stupid and bad, i assume only allies can hear it but it would be better if it was more of a cry for help rather than a low quiet voice of "patch me up" "I need a medic" would make the game more realistic in some way if EVERYONE could hear it though, so if an enemy player is low on HP next to an ally he would attempt to whisper for a medic next to him but under fire he would scream at the top of his lungs for a medic, so they could hear him over the gun fire and same with the players attacking the enemy.The grenades and weapons in this game do need to be improved, i would like if i could DROP my weapon for the enemy weapon on all modes of gameplay which could allow a player to try out let's say a M4 shotgun or something, the grenades though need a fix on them though as flashbangs will blind you no matter what, i threw a flashbang down a hallway and looked away yet to still only be blinded by it, also the tear gas is very useful and unuseful, sometimes the smoke for it will bug out and not show how big the AOF is so you will wander into it without knowing, the fire nade however is too OP if you use it right, as if someone wanders into the fire for a second to back away quickly they will die too fast, it would be better if it did slow damage on the player if they were out of the fire yet crazy damage whilst in the fire, also the character models in this game are okay but it would be better if you could pick between 3 models when you start off.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2015
												Tactical Intervention is...interesting. While not being tactical in any way, it does live up to its name; being an intervention. While many people are on a high from Counter Strike, and CS:GO, T.I. seems like a very possible alternative to dive into. However, even with its decent map design and solid mission modes; T.I. fails in many regards. Keep in mind, this is a free game.Game Play synopsis -  - pay to win does not always win. I found that after a couple hours playing, years back, i could stand my own with an M4 and buying light armor with the in-game points. *Save your GP*  - Shotguns = the noob cannon. I find the best way to deal with these players, is to just stay away. There is always some off chance that a stray bullet with decide to fly across the map and nail you with a headshot. However, the gore and carnage that is left in their path is quite enjoyable to watch.   - invest in a decent pair of boots. Speed is key, and with no universal speed, the ones who can run are the ones who can survive.  - camping is possible but hard to pull off. The feature to spot where your attacker killed you from is a great advantage. *it takes certain skill to defend a corner*  - Spawn time is 10 seconds. Longer than most games, such as C.S. and the instant respawn in a deathmatch.  - The damage stats are garbage. You’ll see damage carry over from previous kills. Upwards of 200, 300, etc. In many cases, 150 damage could be beaten by 140. The number of shots again follows this logic…..oh wait, there is no logic because it makes NO SENSE!  - This game is all about how well you can tolerate those annoying players who live in the middle of nowhere with a ping of +600 and can kill you instantly because they are clipping harder than the Microsoft Word Helper in a paperclip factory.  - You’ll be bombarded by rage quitters, “you’re a 10 yr old boy!” comments, loud music being blasted over the voice chat, and also, the always appreciated, “?how do to change class” stupid questions.------------------------------------------------------------------------------General Review:- Good game- Its FREE- Minimal disk space required- Minimal hardware specs to run at a decent frame rate. - Not for those who easily rage- Slightly cartoonish graphics------------------------------------------------------------------------------Rage Scale-O-Meter:6/10Quality:6.5/10Support:5/10Overall:6.6/10**Remember, it’s a FREE game!!**

content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												Never played this game but Steam said that I actually did so instead of judging the game here's a cool way to make skinny guacamoles with homemade baked tortilla chips :Skinny Guacamole:2 medium green sweet peppers2 medium fresh poblano chile peppers1 bulb garlic1/2 teaspoon olive oil2 roma tomatoes, seeded and chopped1 serrano pepper, minced2 medium ripe avocados, halved, seeded, peeled, and diced1 teaspoon lime zest2 tablespoons lime juice1/2 teaspoon saltBaked Tortilla Chips:Corn tortillasOlive oil spraySaltFor the guacamole:Preheat oven to 425° F. Line a 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking pan with foil; set aside. Quarter, stem, and seed the peppers. Place pepper quarters, cut sides down, in the prepared pan. Cut off the top half inch of the garlic bulb to expose ends of individual cloves. Leaving garlic bulb whole, remove any loose, papery outer layers. Place bulb, cut end up, on a double thickness of foil. Drizzle with the oil. Bring foil up around bulb and fold edges together to loosely enclose. Place foil packet on the pan with the peppers.Roast peppers and garlic for 20 to 30 minutes or until pepper skins are charred and garlic cloves feel soft. Allow to cool about 15 minutes. When garlic head is cool enough to handle, squeeze garlic paste out of the individual cloves.In a food processor combine roasted pepper quarters and the garlic paste. Cover and pulse until combined, but still slightly chunky.In a large bowl, combine tomatoes and serrano pepper. Add roasted pepper and garlic combination and stir to combine. Add diced avocado, lime zest, lime juice, and salt. Gently toss to combine.Serve immediately or cover the surface with plastic wrap and chill for up to 1 hour.For the chips:Cut corn tortillas into wedges and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Spray lightly with olive oil spray and season with salt, to taste.Bake in a 350° F oven for 8-10 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

												I spent over 100 hours on this game, but that was a couple of years ago, 'Tactical Intervention' was my first Steam game, at first I reckoned it was one hell of an amazing game until I started playing CSGO, back in the day the game was well balanced and a bit buggy, the Asia server was pretty popular, things went well during aniversaries they would give you what I think was 50,000 free credits to blow on anything you like; I decided to get back into this game a few months a go only to come to the realisation of, REMOVED SERVERS; now I can't even have any fun with this game unless I have to put up 300-400 ping on an American/European server. On another note, with a limited budget the game has seemingly been abandoned by it's developers.Far worse than what it looks like.- Rating 3/10

												I don't know what to write, so here's the recipe for chocolate chip cookies: Ingredients 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar3/4 cup sugar2 large eggs1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract1 (12-ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips, or chunks2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour3/4 teaspoon baking soda1 teaspoon fine salt Directions Evenly position 2 racks in the middle of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F. (on convection setting if you have it.) Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone sheets. (If you only have 1 baking sheet, let it cool completely between batches.)Put the butter in a microwave safe bowl, cover and microwave on medium power until melted. (Alternatively melt in a small saucepan.) Cool slightly. Whisk the sugars, eggs, butter and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth.Whisk the flour, baking soda and salt in another bowl. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients with a wooden spoon; take care not to over mix. Stir in the chocolate chips or chunks.Scoop heaping tablespoons of the dough onto the prepared pans. Wet hands slightly and roll the dough into balls. Space the cookies about 2-inches apart on the pans. Bake, until golden, but still soft in the center, 12 to 16 minutes, depending on how chewy or crunchy you like your cookies. Transfer hot cookies with a spatula to a rack to cool. Serve.Store cookies in a tightly sealed container for up to 5 days. For a  Rocky Road  Bar Lightly butter a 9 by 13-inch baking pan. Make the batter as per cookie recipe and fold in 1 cup chopped walnuts along with the chocolate chips. Spread batter in prepared pan. Bake until the edges are light brown and the batter sets, about 45 minutes. Cool slightly and cover surface with 4 cups marshmallows and 1 cup chocolate chips. Broil at least 8 inches from the heat until marshmallows turn golden brown, about 2 minutes. (Keep an eye on the marshmallows, and turn the pan frequently--they go from golden to char in a wink.) Cool, cut and serve.

content:
Posted: March 19
												 you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients- To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting - To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs, lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper- ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling.- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough.- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn’t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells.- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a “homemade” touch as well.- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.- Roll the dough into two sheets- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.- Fill with the ravioli mixture.- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli.- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest - Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												One of the better F2P games here on Steam that isn't in a P2W model. TI is a CS clone by one of the original co-creators of Counter-Strike, Minh "Goosemen" Le. So that is to say, a round based FPS hipshooter, involving hostages, bombs, and the escorting of the VIP (Player or AI depending on which level). Pro's  Equipment: Dogs, C4, Riot/Glass Shield, Sniper Rifles, and Armour (All usable in most mission modes). Weapon attachment: Silencer, Flashlight, Acog, Red-Dot, and Holosight (rentable bi-weekly for GP) . Some small perk variations possibilities, extra ammo, XP and GP accuisition, Medkit (rentable weekly for GP). Every gun and piece of equipment is purchasable for permanent with GP, except for Medium and Heavy Armour,  which are rent only. Cars on a few maps!  Lean-tos (Peak and lean mechanic done with Q or E) of which function in the car, allowing for some Dukes of Haphazard spray and pray. A slight sway when scoped in with the Acog attachement or sniper rifles. Team healing (Defaultly set as the T button), albeit unrealistic, but it's no medpack laying in a corner!  Other game modes such as Deathmatch, Free-for-All, and Intel. DLC for custom skins Friendly Fire Cons  Friendly Fire (Some rounds it just needs to be turned to Mirrored rather than Full or Partial... or worse, off) Lack of a tutorial level or a ranked server load for that initial level 1 learning curve (you may get bit swimming with those sharks). No Ironsights! NO IRONSIGHTS!!! rent the Acog Scope attachment already.  The two dogs from the DLC starterpacks have a 4% bonus to one of their 3 stats, being the exception to the P2W model (no other ingame money only bonuses though). Small player base currently, so some issues with which servers are being used due to the low player base.Consider this review a recruitment poster... Uncle Spam needs you!!!

content:
Posted: July 23, 2014
												Having played hundreds of hours, I have to say that this is one of my favorites of all time. Sure its got glitches here and there, but in the end who really cares? Where else can you drive around blasting each other on your way to hand off or intercept a package?So the graphics aren't as slick as COD, but you know what? The game play is a million times better. If you only play games for the most up to date cpu intensive graphics, then go away. Many decry "pay to win". The game works by accepting cash, or in game points to get better equipment or weapons. You start the game with 50K game points, enough to rent out some serious kit, or permanently buy a decent weapon and some extra equipment. You get more GP by doing well in the game. You can get all the equipment you need by playing for a while and saving up points. The only folks who complain are those who want instant gratification. I got everyhting I ever needed not spending a penny, but have supported the developers by buying some DLC items now and then. Believe me, there are folks who spend a bundle on the best weapons, and they aren't winning.Maybe there are beter games out there for deathmatch, but thats not what makes this game shine. It's the mission mode folks, where you and your team must complete missions, or thwart others from completing their misions. Team play is encouraged, by requiring members to heal each other rather thrn thmselves. And sticking in a group is a force multiplier by increasing the teams accuracy. Don't listen to the whiners, read a guide and get in the game. Don't be a tool, help your team and behave likea human. If you get pwned a bunch early on, so what? You gonna rage quit because someone shot you in a FPS game? Go play something else, like jewel quest.graphics: 6/10gameplay: 10/10audio: 7/10

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Edit: Decided to reavualate this game after picking it up again.Gameplay:- Solid gunplay- Variety of guns (smg, assault rifles, snipers, shotguns)- Easy to understand controls- Server browser can suck sometimes (doesn't refresh, hard to click servers at times)Currency (GP):- Grindy at times, 150-300 GP per round in Mission Mode- Some equipment (mostly cosmetic) has to be purchased through your Steam Wallet- "Renting" Guns can be a good tool to try out before buying- The price of guns is somewhat high, although SMG's are a solid purchase for being so inexpensiveCommunity:- No one uses Mics, either a good or bad thing depending on your preference- Not much cooperaton, unless playing with friends (I highly recommend)- Although the game rewards sticking together, there's always one or two "snipers" not doing much- Some elitism at higher ranks, although it could be worse (See MOBA's)With solid gameplay, a decent community, and a somewhat grindy currency filled with in-game purchases, the game could be executed better, but if you put the flaws aside you have a well made and enjoyable game.I suggest downloading it, and trying it out if you enjoy 'tactical' fps games!

content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												I know this F2P is sorta old, but I was curious on how broken this game is and by god is it broken as♥♥♥♥♥♥ but entertaining at the same time. The gameplay and controls are so damn clunky and the weapon models are like basic gamebanana skin models. The weapons recoil are absolutely ridiculous. When shooting at an enemy it's pretty much trial and error on whether you get to get the kill or get killed so accuracy is a ♥♥♥♥ing joke. I wouldn't call this a tactical game as it still seems like the whole run and gun♥♥♥♥♥♥ The worst thing that does make the game terribad are the connectivity issues. Earlier when I first played this I had no issues until later on this evening when I've been losing connection to host every 4, 5, 6, 7 times in a row. I'm not sure whether it has to do witht he host rage quitting or just terrible TI servers. If it really is lobby hosts rage quitting causing the connection to be lose then thats some terrible lobby development there. While the game has a lot of negatives in it, the game does feel a bit entertaining sometimes. There are a few fun and silly game modes that you can really enjoy. Once you get use to the gameplay you'll get better and better at it, but the game can be too boring if you're that good. I sorta half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥this one, but if you want a real tactical arcade challenge then play Counter-Strike. If you want a real Tactical Shooter then play Rainbow Six 3, Ghost Recon, Insurgency, or SWAT 4. Give this a go if you like, but I wouldn't recommend this game. Be best to avoid it due to♥♥♥♥♥♥connectivity.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
												Stop thinking this is pay-to-win, because it isn't. This may be a cheap Counter-Strike clone, but the additional features are what keep me coming back for more. With dogs, car chases, VIP escorts, hostage/civilian rescue/capture and plenty of weapons to keep me interested. While you can pay for guns with real money, there's also the option of paying with Game Points (GP) which doesn't cost you a penny of real cash, just time spent playing the game. This game may require some grinding but once you get past that stage, there's nothing but good times to be had.I must say though, I do wish more Europeans played as the American servers can be a bit laggy which of course restricts gameplay. Just give it a go, it's free-to-play and if you do decide to invest some cash into the game, atleast you'll know it's not as much as you'd spend on those damn CS:GO chests.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2014
												This game, you can like it. And you can hate it.I hate it. Don't ask "Why, why?!" Because I'm explaining everything. The game mechanics and the actual gameplay isn't that bad, there is blind firing, human shields, rolling, and upgrades and in game money. And levels. The game characters are ugly, it looks like they took max payne from 2000 and just retextured it. Seriously, this is 2013 and the Game Developers aren't even trying. And it was made by the co creator of CSS! Oh well. The weapon and level system isn't that bad, except the guns they give you at the starting suck incredibly, and when you buy a better weapon, you can only most of the time only afford to keep it for a week (Ahem, 7 days). The gamemodes are terrible, well, most of them anyway. Two of them are from CS, CSS, and CS:GO, Hostage Rescue, and Plant and Defuse, which is elimination mode most of the time, then there is objective mode which is the hardest and probably the funest, there is three maps, one is hostage rescue, another has a car driving map, and another where you just break in buildings and walk on walls.Conclusion:The game is not bad, and I would say you give it a try.Unless you hate terrible graphics, say goodbye.

number of helpful: 97 of 173 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												[The following is a post that I made in a forum discussion for this game.]Holy ♥♥♥♥ I just came back from playing this, and let me just say that it was so mediocre and seriously undeveloped that I've uninstalled it. The playerbase basically consists of little prebubescent kids screaming "LOL IM RANDOM ARENT I FUNNY FOR THAT LOL" "KOOLAID I LIKE LEMONADE" "WOW LOL GG HASHTAGS" [literal quotes im not even joking]. The modeling for the maps and playermodels are blocky and have an extremely outdated feel to it [like op said]. Graphics, obviously, are not the aspect that truly make a game a well made one [for example: n64/sega genesis games like Goldeneye 007, Ocarina Of Time, Toejam And Earl (which I think im the only one here that remembers it), Sonic, etc]. I was gonna list some PS2 games, but a majority of titles for that console have had in the past, and even today, decent graphics. To bring Tactical Intervention onto that topic: Even if you were to upgrade the game in every single visually appealing way, the gamemodes would still suck major ♥♥♥♥. The most time I spent on a gamemode was Team Deathmatch, the total amount of time being about 20 minutes, until I got way too bored. Tactical Intervention gives me a feeling that it was put on Steam for free as a desperate attempt to revive itself, much like WolfTeam did with Aeria Games. To explain: WolfTeam was ♥♥♥♥ing amazing to me and most people back then. Me and my friends would go on it and glitch through the maps and get kills to get other guys to rage, and even just playing the game vanilla style was pretty damn fun. Well, a few years later, and now it's a sellout with practically abandoned servers and a ton of moneygrabbing tactics to feed the develepors inflating money-grabbing corrupted egos. Looking back on it, the whole WolfTeam getup was good for when it was released, but hell no would it achieve greatness ever again. It's the same concept with this online game: Tactical Intervention was probably, like, the best thing ever when it was in its earlier days. Now all it has left is Steam to back it up to hopefully bring some of the glory back the cheapest way possible. Anyways, to finish off, Tactical Intervention is a game that is ♥♥♥♥ed up in all corners, bringing a ♥♥♥♥ton of errors along with it.*bows* That is all.

content:
Posted: March 24
 Introduction (you can skip this part, kinda) So, I picked this thing up on a warm sunny day in June, I believe and on this day I had loads of fun with it, mostly with the Autobahn level, which was a pretty fun mess of a level, and sadly one of the only fun ones, as I noticed a few months later. Gameplay  Now, here comes the sad part. The weapons are unbalanced and if that wouldn't be enough, the handling is just awful, both of those factors prove well how less of an idea the developers actually had in mind while making this. It is a lot of fun in the first 1-2 hours but then slowly turns into frustration, while you try to grind your way up to a less ♥♥♥♥♥♥ weapon, which is already hard as most of the servers are empty. Maps Honestly, besides the original ideas with the two or maybe even three car levels nothing really original is on any of the maps, neither gameplay- nor stylewise. Most of them are just boring and ugly. Graphics To keep it short: They are bad and somehow make the game run really badly. Conclusion The game is dying right now, if the developer not starts doing something it might very well be completely dead in a month. I would not recommend you playing this game, as the weapons and maps are already pretty bad and not just that but will probably even run badly on your PC. 3/10 -incomplete garbage

number of helpful: 10 of 13 people (77%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
												I would NOT recommend this game to casual players or to FPS newbies. The game requires a lot of participation and time (or money) to become good enough to compete with regular players. One of the best parts of this game is the community. It requires effort and patience to become a meaningful part of that community, but once you know how to play the game and know your teammates, it's just plain FUN!Original review: "I wish I could recommend this game, but unfortunately the Devs have neglected the most important part of it: Anti-cheat.In a pay to win game like this, you can't allow hacking or cheating of any type. Omega has consistently failed to address this issue. For years. I love this game, but I wouldn't recommend it to any new players."Addendum:I wrote this review late at night when I was crabby after running into a couple speed "hacks" (ping discrepency?) and I failed to mention any of the things that I love about this game. Thank you for Bilbur and Plat for checking me on that. I'm leaving the original review, partly to explain and partly to encourage me not to write a review like this again.I don't have evidence for my complaint about cheating, just my game-play experience. It's unfair of me to call out Omega for this one issue when he has been working to improve the game and release content since I first started playing. There are a few issues (such as the water lag in Office and the positioning of hit boxes) that have persisted through several updates. It seems to me that Omega and Fix Games have prioritized new content over these other issues. I would say that the new content improves the game and adds strategic depth, but these issues still need to be addressed.I DO love this game and play a lot, and I do not plan to stop playing it or to stop supporting the game financially. I want VAC because I think the community suffers without it. Because I'm an established player with gear and the experience to use it, I can usually hold my own against any opponent, even one using injectors or other exploits. It's hard enough to play against experienced players as a newb without adding the frustration of dealing with cheaters and trolls/griefers. If you do put the time and effort in, this game is very rewarding. I love the community and the game is just FUN once you learn it. If you are not willing to learn to play and meet the other players, don't bother.

number of helpful: 19 of 31 people (61%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												Being closely involved with CS since it's inception,  when I heard that Gooseman had created a new game I was very interested.  This game has a feel of the original CS.  Unfortunately, this game becomes very lopsided in a hurry as equipment and perks are acquired by higher skill level players making them impossible to beat by players on entry levels.  The micro payment system is also difficult to endure, as well as the long delay between maps.  As well, there are too many items that must be purchased with real money and cannot be earned by game points.  I am referring to tactic altering weapons and accessories including supressors, red dot sights, custom skins, and armor - all of which are available if you're willing to spend $7 to $12  per item and for only a limited 30 days use (for all cool items except for skin cheats which only need be purchased once).  What disappointed me quite a bit is the artistic license the devs decided to take with weapons whose character and standard configurations are sacred in the gaming community.  Everyone knows, for example, that the Steyr Aug's receiver casting includes an integrated 1.5x telescopic sight housing fitted for lenses made by Swarovski Optik.  We pretty much all know that the Aug sight contains a simple black ring reticle with a basic rangefinder.  Curiously, the developers of TI decided to remove the integrated 1.5x sight on the only Steyr Aug that you can acquire in-game on a permanent basis.  The REAL Aug equipped with the standard fixed optical sight can only be acquired when  on a temporary basis when playing TI, and this can only be achieved via a micro transaction of real cash - and you will have to buy said Aug as an item in a  weapons crate  containing a bunch of accessories you don't really need or want - tough♥♥♥♥♥♥- but don't worry about acquiring too much clutter in your arsenal cause all items you get in your crate somehow vanish after 30 days.  That's 30 calendar days, not 30 playing days. Makes me wonder why the developers didn't also program the cars to  transform into pumpkins  at precisely midnight, may as well have the VIP turn into Cindarella holding a mop bucket too.  Which midnight? Good question.  It's midnight once an hour somewhere on the planet.  Insideously,  armor cannot be permanently purchased ever.    What makes me start violently gnashing my teeth is when I am reminded once again --> the items which can only be permanently acquired via micro transaction of real cash are essentially game changing legal cheats.  Yes, I said it, cheats, which I loosely define as advantages that are not available to all players - unless they have cash they are willing or able to hand over via the micro payment system.  Thes advantages these items purchase give players an immediate decided boost, tilting the playing field dramatically.  I can hear many of you now, tsk tsk tsking me, come on now Attrition, do you REALLY want to call these guys out and accuse them of haxoring - they are after all, performing within the framework set up by the developers after all....come on now, I can't imagine it, please, Attrition, describe these cheats of which you speak.   Okay.  I'll touch on one (or two) -  Here's a no brainer: the alternate terrorist skins available for purchase only cause a terrorist appear almost identical to a CT.  Can you look me in the eye and tell me it's cool by you if you're playing as a CT and another CT appears on your screen, when you ignore them since they look like your own team mates and derp derp!! Dead.  You just got PWND. You must be a noob cause you got killed by the guy you mistook for a CT, in a skin that cannot be obtained by game points, only with cash - and once purchased remains in inventory forever.  How about a weapon cheat - you may not call it one but essentially it is when using the Super V SMG.  IRL, Kriss Corporation currently has only built the Vector Super V chambered in .45 ACP with a 5.5" long barrel as the only length availabe in the automatic version.  Kriss says the effective range of this weapon is 45 yards, and even at that distance you're looking at a 37" bullet drop.  In Ti, this SMG is more powerful at distances greater than you can accurately damage using the M4 or AK chambered at 5.56mm and 7.65 x 30 respectively.  The Super V feels as if it's about twice as powerful than the MP7 - and at close range that's understandable, provided the target is NOT wearing body armor.  However, in TI the MP7 doesn't penetrate body armor like the Super V does which makes absolutely no sense.  Basically there's no reason to buy any other gun than the Super V - and most likely one of the TI assbeef devs has a personal copy of the civilian model of the Kriss at home (available for only $599 in usa) where he keeps it in his closet, but at night he comes out of the closet with the proof of his virility and manhood, and  enjoys holding his own SUPER V in front of the full length mirror in his parents basement (where he lives) threateningly posed while admiring himself in the mirror while wearing only underpants and mirrored sunglasses.  Gotta be the reason it's so over powered. Gotta be.The Deathmatch I don't like at all, it's good for the mentally challenged who cannot put together two brain cells long enough to consider such a thing as team work...but at least the spawn points were well thought out.  In deathmatch the server "admin" gets to limit weapons selection - so you may be forced to play with only pistols for instance.  --->WHO THOUGHT IT WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA TO NOT ALLOW THIS FEATURE IN MISSION MODE?!?!?!  I OUGHTA SLAP YOU WITH A TROUT!!!! <---If  Mihn Le had been actually involved developing this game he'd have certainly pushed for a single one time purchase and let players earn perks that don't give them such huge advantages over other players, and he would have understood that the chat window should be easier to read must  stay open longer.  Mihn would have realized immediately how important community involvement is for the success and longevity of any multiplayer game, and this game would more interesting and attract more people for a longer time.  As it is there is zero community involvement because the Server binaries are not released to the public which means you're never going to run your own TI server where you'll be able to kick and ban the punks - an absolute requirement in multi-player online gaming enjoyment.  This also means that the degree of aimbotters and wallhackers has increased dramatically.  And why wouldn't it?  There's no VAC guard, as weak as that is, and no admins to kick punks from servers where they rack up scores of 44 and 0 AS A LEVEL 1 experience player.  WTF?  Really?  Last, the most egregious crap  in this game is the way teams become stacked all the timeand it's silly.  On just about every single room you'll notice one team has three players who have experience over level 25 with a few level 9 or 10 sergeants mixed in....and they're be playing against a team of all level 1 and 2 players who are just getting the hang of the game.  These poor new players get their asses handed to them round after round.  Don't you think you'd get sick of it?  Of course you would - and that, in a nutshell, is the reason TI is never going to be a popular game, never going to have a following greater than it currently does, and will never earn it's dev's a dime after all is said and done.  New blood feels the game is rigged against them - which is too close to REAL LIFE, ain't nobody got time for that.  It's an indication of how completely out of touch these devs are with the core market who support the MP/FPS franchise.  They aren't interested in dialog or communication with the communities of modders, map makers, server admins, and clans who make up the backbone of true blockbusters such as Counter Strike and Team Fortress.  That said, I gotta say, I enjoy the hell out of this game.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												I recommend this game to everyone, those who likes FPS games, and those...who don't. It's really fun if you want it to be. Can be a casual shooter game or a competitive one depending on how you wanna play it and who you play it with. Some may say it's not fun because it gets too hard for them, or just that they play with guys who are new to it or with those who just wants to fool around. Don't just assume it is not a fun game just after a few hours of playing it. It can take time for you to get used to. And even though T.I. is made by the same guys who made C.S., don't compare the two games. Just take it as a whole different game, or at least that's what I suggest.I like this game a lot. It allows you to get guns permanently, there are achievements that may take you a long time to get, a number of maps and modes to play (after the latest update), driving maps which quite a number of FPSs do not have, and also several skins you can purchase to have a different and a more badass look for your own character. To be honest, I got hooked on this game for months and I still like this game a lot more than other FPSs I have played before. T.I. is also not so much of a 'pay to win' game compared to some of those I have played. Yes it is true you can purchase stronger guns when you are only a level 1 with real cash, but even so, everything can be bought with in game money other than skins. So I personally wouldn't call that pay to win, since you are just buying things to have it faster. It's not like you bought a gun that's only purchaseable with real cash. But well, I respect the opinions of others if they do disagree with me.But of course, there is also the downside of this game.1. Little laggy.There are quite a number of players in this game that face lag. Even though there are players from all over the world, it is still kinda bad. But even so, if you are able to deal with a little lag, it shouldn't affect you that bad. And for those of who you gets really bad lag, like maybe around 20 FPS or lower, if you are using a laptop, try keeping it charged. That's what I do and the lag is gone. May only be for me. I don't know..Ohh. And if you are playing with lag, I suggest you to not play at driving maps that often. Can be chaotic..2. T.I. communityWell, just like in most games, there will be people you will meet who are complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. There will be ragers, whiners,  trolls, etc. Just ignore them if you can't take this kinda crap. And if they annoy you over the microphone, just mute them in-game. Good thing they have that option.. If you are able to deal with them, good for you. If you can't, well....try harder..3. HitmarksAfter the latest update in July 2014, the hit registers have been screwed up. It's harder to land hits on target now that the hitmarks aren't as accurate compared to before. Not sure if this applies to all guns, but I notice this problem mainly for the assault rifles. Would appreciate it if this issue gets fixed quick, like say..to how it was before the update on April 2014? Then, the hitmarks were dead on.4. Game developmentSadly, there are only 4-5 developers working on this game at the moment. So, updates can take awhile. But when updates do come, it may not necessarily make the game a 100% better. Like from the latest update in July, it's good they brought in new maps and new game modes. But the hit registers also got messed with. It can take awhile for problems to be fixed and all, but it would be nice if there were more people helping out on the game development. More people to get things done, and more people to get to understand what people actually want to see in T.I and implement them. If things go well with the development of the game, and when more people start playing and supporting this game, the developers would get more income which would keep them motivated. Would be nice for both sides don'tcha think?Well, to sum it up, I recommend Tactical Intervention to gamers out there from all over the world. Yeah, there are problems here and there, but it's still pretty fun. And hey, it's FREE! Would call it a poor man's C.S, but it is better than it sounds, in my opinion at least. It would be nice to have some of you guys to volunteer to help out developing this game too. Also, from what I mentioned about the issues after some updates, don't be too disappointed from what you get as of now. It will be fixed and it will get better....hopefully..

number of helpful: 16 of 26 people (62%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												It's about as far as you can get from Counter-Strike's tense and tactical stand-offs (though maybe that's because of the lack of a 5v5 ranked adversarial mode), but Tactical Intervention still manages to offer satisfying and surprisingly fun action, with a unique blend of old-school mechanics and (for lack of better terminology) New Age multiplayer FPS sensibilities, offering the best of both worlds while steering relatively clear of the excesses of other games on the market...... except for its in-game economy, which borders on pay-to-win, and doesn't even seem to be doing the developers any favors, monetarily speaking. The starting weapons are decent, make no mistake, but all other weapons which can only be obtained through the in-game store are notoriously overpowered, and other cosmetic gear items provide similarly unbalanced boosts for a variety of stats (truth be told, they don't really seem to do anything either, which is even worse). You're expected to grind matches to obtain points in order to purchase items on a temporary ownership basis, as permanent gear can cost so many points that you'll likely be tempted to pay up with real money (which is probably the intention here).Still, Tactical Intervention is a game worth trying out, and it does have some value worth offering if you can stick with it. It also has attack dogs, and that makes it worth at least the hard-drive space, in my book.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2014
												---THIS GAME IS FUN. 10/10 WOULD PLAY AGAIN---As of July 2014, this game is online-multiplayer ONLY. When you start, you have a stock set of weapons and no equipment. (Personally, I can use these stock weapons and WIN vs good players, just gotta aim!) You start with 50k in GP, enough for a good primary and secondary gun, with money left over. You will need to play or pay to earn GP and buy guns and equipment. Items like combat boots give a slight speed and stamina bonus. Gloves give more melee damage and item use speed. Googles protect from flashbangs... Plenty of other items to earn along the way.What I like about this game...-Simple controls, easy to customize button layout and HUD display-Small/medium sized maps with simple layouts for quick paced action, easy to learn-Several game modes (bombing, deathmatch, VIP escort, hostage rescue, driving, and more)-Teamwork is emphasized: Bonus points for healing team, aim bonus for staying near teammates-Small community of players, very friendly and funWhat I dislike about the game-Small community of players! We need more people playing this game!I know it's not much of a review... but if you have any questions, please add me on steam and ask!

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
Product received for free
												Imagine good old Counter-Strike on steroids...Maybe not polished as CS:GO, but it's free and can give you a decent amount of fun.Not every game needs to be a competitive type.It takes some time, but once you get used to it...Sit back, relax, and drive the VIP to the final destination. Or be a passenger, and help your SWAT team on the way, to protect the VIP... or be on the opposite side, and chase them, shoot them down and don't let them escape...... or just hop into a TDM or FFA if you just want to shoot and respawn quicker when you die.Not much players there, but if you have 3 more friends, it could be very fun playing 2 vs 2, in a private match.Remember, it's free. There are purchasable / rentable things in game (for in-game or real cash), but you can do good with the default guns too, so it's not a big deal... it's not Pay2win.

number of helpful: 66 of 123 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												[▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲]Tactical Intervention feels somehow like Counter-Strike done right but is of course unique in it's own way by being much more detailed and offering a bigger difference when it comes to variety of game modes to choose from and a much more living environment that you can integrate with on some maps. Now you're probably wondering what kind of game this TI really is, huh? Well let me try to explain it briefly: TI is the way the community always wanted it to be, a better and quicker way of playing where experience points is not required to unlock weapons only in-game credits which is given after every match played and that gives every new player a fighting chance. Below you'll find all sorts of information regarding the game, take a look you might find something helpful.[▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲]-=> Tips & Trix <=-Looking for a guide on how to play TI? Then you've come to the right place, just scroll down to the bottom of this page to find the guide. Hope that you find this review helpful and don't forget to press the: |LIKE| button above & spread it to your friends so more people get a chance to experience TI.[ Information! ]A super fast paced first person shooter that offers an intense adrenaline rush when playing "Vip-Escort" or "Team Deathmatch" whether it's in a car-chase, a strategic mission map or blood a splattering deathmatch, either way you choose to play you'll find TI insanely entertaining, every map offers it's own unique gameplay & strategic design and can be used to your advantage if playing tactically. This game is purely based on teamwork and staying close to your teammates will give you accuracy bonus and the possibility to get healed.[ Modes! ]Rating: (9/10)Bomb Plant, Hostage Rescue VIP-Escort including cars & Of course the classic Team Deathmatch. Feels great to have so many modes to choose from in the same game, it makes for a sweet rotation.[ Content! ] Rating: (9/10)TI offers a nice variety of weapons and equipment for customizing your character in many different ways, alot of new content is added frequently which improves it even further. The recoil system provided in TI is one of the most well balanced in any FPS game ever and it just runs & feels really smooth and it reacts properly. The characters are really well made and the weapon models binds it all together nicely, surely animations can be a bit slack but will be fixed in the future. The damage factor is properly divided depending on body part hit so shooting someone in their legs and feet will require many more bullets than shooting him in the stomach etc.[ Maps! ]Rating: (10/10)The maps surely are top-class and the environments are wonderfully crafted and we can barely wait to see the new maps to come in the near future that will be even better and offer even greater strategic gameplay. They feel really light and natural which adds a great atmosphere to the game and a depth not really found in other Source engine based games such as trees, rocks and rays of light. The textures are also very well made and unique in every map which is nice since it doesn't get so repetative.[ Personal Opinion! ] Rating: (10/10)Highest possible rating because of the potential & depth that TI offers and not what it currently lacks. It feels more alive and unique in it's own way than most games out there today and the future looks bright for TI. All the small details really binds this game together and it makes it feel personal. I used to play Counter-Strike since 1999 to recent times and pretty much all the famous FPS games ever released in between too, sure they we're great in their own way. Yet somehow this game just raised the bar to another level that is unmatched by most games today because it feels much more personal and not like mainstream crap made to suit everyone. TI offers hardcore gaming at it's best!>Absolutely recommended to be enjoyed with friends![▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲|▲]{ STARTER GUIDE! }To begin with you'll start with 10.000 credits and that will cover all the cost of the items to start with if used properly. It is wise that you don't use all of it right away or you'll regret having to use the lesser powerful starting guns when the ones you got expire. And it will only force you to stop playing due to rage. So I'm going to explain to you how to start your TI career properly. Read slowly and try to absorb as much as you can. I suggest you open this guide while in-game for a much quicker & easier access! A few more years and this will become a world famous game not a single doubt about that at all. Below you can see text marked like |This|, that means it's a button. Follow the list and you'll be good to go in a couple of minutes. So when you've entered the desired lobby, click the |SHOP| button. Now this is where you will have to work a little on your own. x=-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------=x[ How to equip items? ] To equip/edit the new gear click the |INV| button. Tip: Customize 1 character in each team with armor to suit all missions.To equip/edit the new weapons click the |RACK| button.Tip: Customize the loadout by having at least 1 purchased weapon in any category.x=-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------=x (1.) <{ Weapons! }> Click: |Assault| & Hire the [AK-47] For: (1 day) -Epic if properly used. }> Alternative: Hire the [G36] For: (1 day) -Comes with a 2.5x zoom scope. Click: |Pistols| & Hire the [Mr96] For: (1 day) -Hand cannon, suitable at all ranges. }> Alternative: Hire the [XD-45] For: (1 day) -Automatic pistol best suitable for car maps.x=-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------=x (2.) <{ Equipment! }> Click: |Equipment| & Hire the {Light Armor} For: (1 day) -Until you can afford heavy armor. }> Alternative: |Equipment| & Hire the {Heavy Armor} For: (7 days) -A true game changer!x=-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------=x (3.) <{ Appearance! }> Click: |Head| & Hire the (GSG9K 2K9 Helmet) For: (1 day) -> CT Click: |Head| & Hire the (Protektor Helmet) For: (1 day) -> T Click: |Hands| & Hire the (Flight Gloves) For: (1 day) Click: |Feet| & Hire the (GSG9K 2K10 Boots) For: (1 day) -> CT Click: |Feet| & Hire the (Trail II Shoes) For: (1 day) -> T Click: |Holsters| & Hire the {Woodland holster I} For: (1 day)x=-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------=x Or: |Black Market| Purchase the {Starter Pack} For: (7 days)Starter pack [Cost: 10.000 Credits!] -Hope you got a free week.x=-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------=x-Hopefully we will see each other in-game. If I'm playing you can always locate me somewhere on the EU1 server. Thank you for taking your time to read my review, hope you found it helpful. Please take good care and I really hope you get to enjoy TI the way we did.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2014
												The game has its ups and downs, but lets be honest, all games do. Yes the animation and graphics can be better, but it's not always about the graphics, its about the community and the gameplay. The game is not pay to win, despite what some people might belive. By the time you hit around level 30, you should have a main assault rifle, a smg, helmets, goggles, gloves, boots, and armor (optional). Even if lets say god forbid somebody buys a gun permanently, then so what? It's a fps game, it still takes skills to aim a gun. The guns are fairly balanced, even more so now that there is a recoil system now, you can't just spray and pray most of the time. I would say give this game a try first, it's free, and you start off with 50k gp which gets u a nice permanent assault riffle right off the bat. If you don't like it then fine, uninstall and move on. If I had read the reviews before I started playing, and if I had listened to them I would have missed out on an awesome game. The developers actually listen to us, they are currently planning a tournament soon it's starting on july 12. So come join us, and have some fun.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												When Minh-Gooseman-Lee said that he made this game to be "fun" , he wasn't lying ..tactical intervention is a crazy fun multiplayer FPS , think CoD meets Counter-Strike and you got yourself Tactical Intervention , fun game modes like your usual TeamDeathMatch and the classic Bomb and Hostages Missions , to driving cars and going through an insanely fun mayhem with your friends down the highway in escort the vip missions ..tactical intervention is a game that has the soul of Counter-Strike , and the body of a fun,fast-based game , so if you have some spare time and you'd like a quick game that is absolutly free to play , where your skills are the winning factor and not your money , give this one a try and who knows .. you might get hooked for longer than you ever thought you would !The game is a F2P game that has in-game currency as well as real money , so you can buy 90% of the things with your earned in-game points and build your own character without paying anything , yes it takes some matches and wins to get more points but in my opinon it's done just right ...  for example , you can buy the best weapon in the game for 1 day with the points you won after doing a mission , or you can save up for a couple of weeks to buy it permenantly , it's always your call and you're never forced to pay anything ..Download size is about 3GBs so it's not really that big , system requirements are also low giving that the game runs on the old source engine , so most machines will have no problem running it , stronger machines will be able to handle the game at highest settings with no real problems and for a 60FPS , the game looks good enough for a F2P game that is made on the Source engine , it's not the best looking game out there but it still is pretty good in some places ..so yeah , give it a try , it's the kind of game that you either love it or hate it .. so try it out yourself and i hope you'll end up having alot of fun in it with your friends and buddies :) !

content:
Posted: April 11, 2015
												What I'm about to give you is a near to honest opinion from a guy who's put about 51 hours into this. Alright, let's start off with the good that this game has to offer.+Car chases.*+Customisation.+Decent map design.... That's about it. Hoooo boy, the negatives. -95% of the community is♥♥♥♥♥♥-PAY TO WIN.-If you want to buy weapons with GP, you will need to grind for two whole days, approximately.-Hardly any updates or nerfs to anything.-That "breaching"♥♥♥♥♥♥it tells you in the description? None here.-About as tactical as Call of Duty most of the time.-*Car chases are tedious as ♥♥♥♥ - you WILL need a good team or else you are screwed. -*Only thing that will grab you is the fact it has car chases involved.Overall: This game is wasted potential and just fell on it's♥♥♥♥♥ If it wanted to be tactical, it needed to feel tactical and not just be another lack-luster P2W game by slapping a pretentious title on itself. Should you need any ounce of tactical gameplay that's free to play and that requires more thought, just play Ghost Recon: Phantoms or something. Better yet, just ♥♥♥♥ing buy Counter Strike - any one of them will do (except Nexon).

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												You like this game or hate it, I personally like it. TI does best in it's general gunplay It rewards Fast thinking and teamwork. Some people have said the game is very choppy, I have not experienced this [I have a great vid card] so I wouldn't know. The graphics are not amazing by any means but You can still tell what your looking at, the AS50 is a very overpowered rifle and shouldn't even be in the game,This is made worse by bad TDM spawns, Highway is the best mode in my opinion It was kinda fun driving around Trying to avoid terrorists. With a little bit more work this game could be great. Overall i give it a 7/10 Good to play if you want to play a free tactical shooter and don't care about graphics much.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2013
												This game is really easy if you play FPS's. Apparently kids with no arms play this game.But really, this game has alot of potential and can be VERY fun if you play with a team that you can properly work with. It actually gets rather boring if you play against/with pubs because you just end up stomping if you have played an FPS before. I would say 85% of players cause the following gamebreaking issues as this game is all about teamwork, while the 15% are the heros in the match that do everything. PUBS DO NOT- Heal you- Stick together- Communicate- Follow the objective- Kill enemies you would assume would be an easy kill for themPUBS DO- Complain the game sucks because they didn't get a non default gun- Leave matches midway- Stand Still and watch enemies- Crash cars when driving. This game works best if you organize a match with people you know. It gets really fun when you actually start having to use cover properly and work with teamates when fighting intelligent enemies.*Recommend for groups of players, playing alone will only frustrate you*

content:
Posted: April 15, 2014
												Tactical Intervention is a quite intricate take of things on Counter Strike. Created by a co-creator of CS, I was quite pleased to see the changes they had made to it. With some smarts, and patience, one COULD get really good at it, I thought. To an extent, that may have been true. But I can't help but think the devs were a little too greedy with this game, and a bit unfair in other aspects, as well....First off, the game is a nice take of CS, with great features like rappelling, player VIP escort, drivable cars, breaching charges too! It all seems great, at first. You'll soon find out that rappelling is worse than useless, noob VIPs get themselves killed, thus ending the round, the cars mechanics are absolutely HORRIBLE, and the breaching charges are overpriced. Oh, did I mention that? EVERY perk, attachment, accessory, pretty much anything besides the actual weapons need actual $$$ to use, and most for only a month, as there is no perma unlock for them. I know, crazy, right? But hear me out.The guns themselves are decent, save for one. They can be permanently unlocked, but it is a pain in the @$$ to do when you only have the default guns. What's wrong with the default guns, you ask? They are significantly lower dmg, accuracy, and mag size. Useless. Good thing is, you can rent guns to get ingame money to payoff your rent and even profit, with the right application of use.This needs a seperate paragraph of its own. The Super V. Basically the Vector, it outclasses the M4, AK, G36, every other SMG and assault rifle, destroys shotguns and pistols, and snipers aren't even a challange, unless they have 50 meters on you. Even then, its anyone's guess. Accuracy, damage, RPM, this gun has it all. You can use it in a car, on land, in hell, anywhere. It will ruin the poor fool in front. Devs need to fix this, FAST, or this game could quickly degnerate into people relying on other people's sense of goodwill and benevolence.Honestly though, my take of this game is that it is very good. It has a small community really, so once you meet the right people, (the decent ones with hearts), you will be able to actually play with them, use some strategy, maybe. Strategy in this game, with a closely knit, communicative, strong team will beat almost any opposition out there. Maybe a rehaul in graphics, but that's a minor thing, definitely a change in the whole $$$ grabbing thing, though. Change the way you get the accessories, attachments, aesthetical changes, etc, and maybe TI will get a larger following. That, and a basic autobalance so that it isn't all lvl 40-50s on one team, and like 5 lvl 1-4's on the other. I still reccommend this game, because hey, if you don't give up on it, and you persist, it will quickly grow on you after a while. Then fall off. But let that happen later.

content:
Posted: April 25, 2014
												This game has a lot of good ideas, and some very cool features. However, I think the free-to-model kills it. Though the developers do give the player enough in-game currrency to buy at least one permanent weapon - choose wisely. Mission game modes are where you want to spend most of your time, if you're into tactical shooters similar to counter-strike. I didn't feel like its TDM mode was the highlight of the show. Actually it kind of feels unnecessary and thrown in for a particular crowd, maybe. Yet everyone seems to play TDM, and that is likely where all new players will start their experience. It is because of that that I don't recommend this game. However, I do recommend one tries the game playing Mission mode exclusively. I will have to play further to determine for myself if all the missions are worth the time, but I am turned off by the free-to-play model - which can be easily exploited for pay-to-win.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												UPDATE 1Many people compare TI to CS, which is understandable, because of the Gooseman’s legacy and that the TI “feels/looks” the closes to CS, but TI is not CS and that is the reason why people like me and all the rest of the dedicated TI players like the game. If I have to describe/compare with a single sentence both of the game I would say “If CS is like a professional boxing with strict rules and limitations, then TI is like MMA (Mixed Martial Arts).” CS is stripped from any kind of “tunings” except the bullet vest/helmet and the defuse kit, which is good for competitive/sport matches (you know what to expect). But in the other hand TI is more arcade, you can tune/create your own “class and style” of game play similar to Team Fortress 2, but without the limitations of predefined classes. You still need some skills to shoot precisely (deal with recoil), use tactics (communicate), use grenades, which I love how they behaves, not like in CS (in CS there are just two useful grenades, flash bang and smoke all the rest are joke), when you throw frag grenade, tear gas, smoke, flash bang you know what to expect and the other side have to get the hell out from there, if they want to survive and even so they still can be blinded for a while after or knocked down from the blast or have a blurred vision, smoke is passive grenade and the incendiary is more or less like the smoke to create a barrier, but not to kill. You can rush/run for your life or to attack, you can peak, you can roll, there is bullet penetration (although not always predictable and sticking guns from the glass walls make greater damage than no sticking, but hey no one is perfect ;)). There is a map and if you make noise (shooting, running or even moving will give your position away) good for ambushing campers. And if you get tired from all that bomb, rescue, escort game play, then you have cars :). There are plenty of weapons, gears and perks to choose from and you start the game with 50000GP enough to buy a decent assault rifle permanent or rent all bunch of stuff. Compared to all that CS is much more limited, plain and simple, which as I said, has its good sides.  TI compared to Call of Duty is still “realistic”, so no any air strikes, missiles etc, maybe just the dogs are that little “too much”, but there is match limitation for them, so it is so so bearable. Although TI is free to play, it is not (at least by my opinion) pay to win game, you can buy absolutely everything in the game with earned game points (GP) just by playing it, the only thing which cannot be bought with GP are the custom skins, which do not have any direct influence on your player specs.If you want to have a look at the rest of that letter and the current issues with tha game here is the link:http://steamcommunity.com/app/51100/discussions/0/46476145348892070/******************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************There are so many good and so many bad things, which can be said about this game and this review, can be really long, but no one will read it, so it is waste of time for me to write it in details. All I will say is:1.	I have bought CS:GO a week before I have installed TI and so far, I have accumulated 125 hours on TI, I am level 23 and I have bought quite few items (already have spend about 260,000GP) and I have accumulated just 6 hours on CS:GO and those are actually, because I have started to play CS:GO now/recently.2.	I am a real world, skill/tactics based, FPS fan and TI had it all and more than any other FPS, I have ever played, but all the romance disappeared after I started to notice some serious unbalance in the game and after a while it is not anymore that much about skills, than just, what gadgets/items you have equipped. From that point on, it will start to become more and more a rat race to gain more GP and buy better armor, shoes, gloves etc, because it will highly influence your success rate, mind you I am not talking about the weapons…. and it begins to feel more like a RPG game than a skill game.  When you win or lose, you know and the rest of the players know (even, if some of them do not admit it), that most of the time you win or lose, because of the better gadgets/items you or they have equipped and the skill factor and the satisfaction of winning are pathetic, if you have to be honest to yourself.3.	I do understand, that the game is F2P and the developers need to make money, but if I buy some DLC, I will become even more overpowered and it will be more like shooting fish in a barrel, than a fair challenge and satisfaction for all the players. I guess that is a common point for most F2P games and the main reason of their decease, which will be really pity for such a great game :(.
