												Not sure what to write so here's some useless facts about algae:Algae is a one-celled plant that can grow in your pool if conditions are favorableThere are over 20,000 known varieties of algaeAlgae are mainly found in marine or freshwater environmentsAlgae produce oxygen which other aquatic life uses.Algae are important to humans in the form of food and medicine.Algae are vital in many food chains acting as the primary producer of organic matter.In some areas of the Indian ocean the sea surface lights up at night. It is so bright that one can read a newspaper. This light is caused by tiny sea algae, the Dino-flagellata. Sometimes the lightened surface has a diameter of more than 1.5 km.Algae are used in many wastewater treatment facilities, reducing the need for harmful chemicals, and are used in some power plants to reduce carbon dioxide emissions.Red algae are important members of coral reefs. Red algae are unusual among the algae because they can include in their cell walls calcium carbonate which makes the plants hard and resistant to wear.Brown algae are found mainly in the tidal zones of temperate to polar seas, but some exist in the deep ocean. Among the brown algae are the largest and most complex of the algae; well-known forms include the giant kelp and the free-floating sargassum weed.Algae have chlorophyll and can manufacture their own food through the process of photosynthesis.Kelps are the largest algaes. They can be more than 200 feet.It is the major food for fishes.The oceans cover about 71% of the Earth’s surface, yet algae produce more than 71% of the Earth’s oxygen; in fact, some scientists believe that algae produce 87% of the world’s oxygen.They also help remove huge amounts of Carbon Dioxide.Oxygen was poisonous to the organisms that populated the early Earth. By producing oxygen, the first algae may have created the greatest toxic waste crisis in history.Fossilized Algae are used to make dynamite.Algae may be able to help save the planet.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												I've been playing FPS since Wolfenstein 3D...yes the original.  I'm old.  That said, when I beat FEAR 2 on my CPU while on a "business trip" I was looking for an online FPS to fill my time.  I tried CS and a few other Free To Play games.  I even tried TI and decided at first that I didn't care for it.  However, I realized that TI offered the ability to advance through earning levels and GP to purchase better equipment.  I began to play it more and more.  Once I picked up a few guns early on for cash, I improved a bit.  Then a bit more.  Then I earned enough GP in game to buy all the guns permanent.  My advice for new players.  If you like the game, drop $14 or so on it (1/3 of the cost of a game like CoD) and get a solid starter pack.  Then use your GP to buy all the rest of the guns.  Don't forget to outfit yourself with gloves, shoes and other gear to start too (much of which is in starter packs).  It's NOT a pay to win game, but paying a bit up front helps you get a better start.  I love TI.  It's the only game I play regularly any more.  It's a growing entity with so much to offer.  The community is pretty cool.  The developers are very involved.  It's just a ton of fun.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
												I wouldn't pay much attention to the meta critic score any more or the older bad reviews for this game. Recently got into this game out of curiousity. I was bored and saw the game just sitting there as "free to play." So I said ♥♥♥♥ it, why not? I wanted to shoot something, and if it meant a Counter Strike kind of game, why not? I expected the bugs and glitches the game has, and visually a bit rough, because it's a source engine game made by a small group of developers. How ever I wasn't expecting the amount of joy I'd get out of playing this game. Just little things like rappelling down the side of a building to rescue hostages, or using a hostage as a human shield, or having my character followed by a trained attack dog. Though I think the games high light personally is the Car Chase maps. I think if the developers really wanted to change the game around and rake in cash, it would be by focusing on the Car Chase map designs. Barreling down a high way full of traffic, as terrorists and counter-terrorists alike shoot out windows at each other, trying to blow out a tire, or sending a RPG shrieking across the street to nail the VIP car, is by far the most fun I've had in a FPS in a long while. This is not just a positive reviews, but me begging developers to make more vehicular chase maps, by far the best part of the game. For both the action and hillarity.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
One of the most fun, interesting, intense and awesomely frustrating games I have ever played. The community is pretty small so far so there are a bunch of really good people to play with but quite a few new players every week or so. For a free game I find it very balanced. The Pay-to-Play features with most free games is practically non-existent. The in game currency is so easy to obtain that anybody can buy anything in the game and be just as good as everyone else. You could spend real money to buy a gun or you can also play 10 games or so and buy it yourself. All real money is good for are buying cool skins, but even then the skins don't add or change the game play. All in all I would give this game a large thumbs up and recommend this game to anybody who wants a free, fun and fair FPS shooter.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												Tactical Intervention does look a lot like Counter Strike. Thsi is probably becausae it has been amde by I believe either the same company or developers that helped develop Counter Strike. I own counter strike and plodding through it I have to say I was not impressed. The one kill and you are dead during TDM (Team Death Match) was not fun as I constantly felt like a noob on it.This game is better than Counter Strike. You can drive cars in VIP Escort (CT Mission) Assasinate VIP (Terrorists), you have the basic hostage rescue mission like CS and bomb mission again like CS. You start with 3 choices of weapon, a Scorpion sub machine gun, a boklov shotgun and I believe an M1 rifle. All these weapons feel fairly light when going against enemys with xp paid/ premium paid weapons. Dont be fooled I have won matches where I was only team member against 2 other enemys with nothing but boklov shotgun. Give it a chance.Maps dont look overly pretty but they feel so much fun to blow apart as if you play Office map on TDM or FFA you can blow CPU and filing trays apart to give better view or hide behind. The game feels like you have more startegy. In an escort mission as CT do you zoom ahead and meet the VIP at the drop off point where you are ready to defend or smash terrorist off the road and just generally slow them down, or stick with the VIP car no matter what. Tires can be shot out and if your car gets trashed GTA mother**&&^^ andjust chuck a civilian out GTA style. Dont run them over though that cost you 80 xp points. Kills usually get you 20 unless its  a head shot 1 kill where you get 40 xp.The VIP looks liek an indavidual charchter he looks like a French Gendarme.Maps are varied and you have about 15 ounds 7 as CT and 8 as Terrorists. When you shoot a man at point blank range in the chest with a shitgun...he knows about it as bits of red meat fly over the map. So much fun.In short this feels an interesting look and very indavidual version of a fairly old format cops and robbers. If like me you see Battlefield Hardline but remember Origin wouldnt allow you to play your Battlefield 3 game because it asked for you to sownload plugin endlessly and nothing happened, just take my advice stick with tthis game. You can even buy a dog for 1000 xp if I remember correctly.May be a little more.All in all hillarious, and for the first 9 level you can play with players of the same level if you are like me and want to play European servers but its a day when not many playing go to USA 1 server up to 250 people playing on a good day and I find connection is ok.

												Hmmm, I have an urge to bash this game and say it is a blatent ripoff off of Counter Strike. But in all honesty, that doesn't do the game any justice. It has the same features as Counter Strike but how you play and what you do will greatly affect your experience. First of all, Graphically, it uses the Source engine so the graphics are decent but defineatly not great. On my machine at max settings, textures have the same resolution as a Minecraft block. Furthermore, the animations are stiff and unrealistic. However, just like in Counter Strike shooting is good. You have 3 default weapons which are all good and balanced well and even the shotgun doesn't seem overpowered. The maps are fairly large with open space and little nooks and crannies. Most maps are designed for 6v6 gameplay although some maps are big enough to hold 24 players. There are the standard TDM but there is an interesting gamemode called Highway. As the name suggests you drive a car and shoot people in other cars and retrive the intel. Nothing in this game is unique but it is not supposed to. It is simply a F2P Counter Strike. However with all the problems the game has I would rather buy a $20 game like Counter Stike because it would provide a  better experience. Oh, did I mention the screen shake? But to be fair, you get enjoyement when you play this game, which is why my final veredict for this game is a 7/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
												This is a simple first person shooter that looks like Counter Strike Global Offensive on steroids, except that this game was actually made by one of the leading developers of Counter Strike before he quit, got drunk, and slept in a box on the sidewalk. But enough about him. Let's get right into the review.Straight foward, this is a fun game. It's absolutely ridiculous in some ways, but I mean it in a good way. You have highway maps where you can drive in a high speed chase down a busy city. It has a big veriety: Small maps or big maps, small guns or big guns, small objectives or big objectives, and small cars or big cars. And blood goes everywhere. Really. If you're under 18, and I'm not even kidding, this is as bad as the Killing Floor.Sadly, since this is a freetoplay game, that also means it's buy to win. But it's easy to get money, you just have to complete missions.Really, I love this game, and I play it often. I hope you download this, but don't take my word for it. Take the advice from the hobo hiding in a box on the side of the street that made this game in the first place. :)

content:
Posted: August 31, 2013
												Its hard to review a game like this. as theres alot of people trying to compare it to other games.Yes it is SIMILAR to counterstrike but it has a totally different feel to it.Firstly The Gunplay:The gunplay like CS does take some skill to get used to but you cant just spray willy nilly like CS if u know the spraypattern. TI requires precision aiming and burst firing that are different for every gun that makes them distinct. I personally like the feel of how the gunplay is handled and it feels very right with the other aspects of the game.next up the Movement.this is the part i love the most. In TI they have Dodgerolls to put out fire & making it harder to get hit. Stamina Cooldown. Leaning Left & Right for Peaking & a over head peaking. basically you have many aspects of being able to do things to evade & shoot that makes this very Tactical and helps the flow of the game.on the whole its a game where ull need to sit a few hours to get a real feel for it but its a great game if you take it as it is.be warned that you might get stomped as it has a skillcurve but thats just how it is. but if you put in 5 or 10 hours ull likely get the flow of it and it just keeps getting better from there.the items are fairly price and u start with a decent amount of ingame currency to buy a gun straightup if you want but its best to test them out nowadays to see if you like them.TLDR:Great game why arnt u trying it out already its F2P.if you got any questions just ask me.Teufel outtt

												Like a good sequel should, Tactical Intervention doesn’t ignore the formula of fast, fluid gameplay that has made the series famous, but introduces a unique new premise, unprecedented player personalization, and sweeping changes that breathe new life into the multiplayer experience. It’s over-the-top and at times unnecessarily complex, but serves both current and next-generation consoles with ambitious new ideas and tremendous replay value.

content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
												This is the single most greatest game ever made. Skyrim needs to take notes. The gameplay is 11/10 and the graphics are astounding. This game is optimized for every PC, and has the greatest driving mechanics I've ever seen in a game. I feel like GTAV took the driving mechanics from this game. And better yet, it has a first person view. As a terrorist if you leave the area you'll get sniped, this further enhances the gameplay expierence by destroying the feelinf of exploration by trapping you in an enclosed area. This alone makes the game feel very alive.This game has no pay-to-win features and have completely balanced weaponry, with the exception of a few (evenly balanced) DLCs.Great game.

												UPDATE: JIM ITS DEAD.. The games dead dont even bother downloading this. Only EU servers left and the admins dont give a fk anymore. After they changed (Now to FixGames, who apperently dont fix a♥♥♥♥♥♥.) it just got worse and worse. I got atleast 10 pictures of different ingame bugs and glitches. Ignore what is down below this. Its just dead.This game is.. a mixture of emotions. It is a pretty good game, i enjoy it when i game with friends and buddies. The mechanics are almost alright. The guns handle pretty... unique, though difficult for newbies and ameteurs alike (and im sure even some pro's will agree the handling is pretty difficult when compared to other games.) There is a shop that lets you buy things with In Game Points (GP), but most of the greatly customized things (permanent attachment guns are pretty rare and limited edition) and skins and playermodels are all bought with $$$. An offer that allows you to buy said customization would be great, also the option to buy attachments permanently rather than a 2 week rent would be great as well!The major complaints are the community. Its just as bad as CoD most of the time. High lvls are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s most of the time, especially since most of THESE people cheat to achieve such levels. The game lacks VAC, which makes hackers stick to this game like flies on honey. Not only do these "High" levels disorient new players to automatically delete this game (i could point out this could be considered cyberbullying believe it or not), but they also ruin the fun for other gamers who try play this game fairly. The voting system... well it sucks. It is completely broken and makes even kicking an obvious hacker a hassle since most of the time the voting screen wont pop up. All these, in addition to slow action from admins and well.. the lack of them (never seen an admin in my game time to be honest). The game quickly went from having over 600 players! 600 was plenty, always rooms to join, and places to come to and play. Poeple would join pretty quick (600 might seem insignificant, but in this game, where ya need a minimum of 4 players to start a match and max was 20, it was plenty. and im talking of the USA1 server alone). Now... barely 150 when the game is at its peak, and 100 barely most of the time, play this game usually. and the other servers are empty, so im talking literally 100 players playing all servers (USA1 is the only server used). Out of these 100 players, a vast mayority are hackers (im including aimboters to the term just for this review.) I have heard a lil rumor VAC will finally be enabled in a week or two.. but is it too late for this nifty F2P FPS game? or will it attract gamers back to this once wonderful game? Only the Developers will be able to save this game.Edit:I have seen cheats and have reported atleast 6 or 7 people. Not to mention the massive aimbot community.  The community is horrible a lot. (have images to prove that one actually) and well, there is some hope. VAC is coming to TI very soon (bout a week maybe i heard), but is it too late? The community ranges about an average of 110 players online at any time (pretty low considering the 600-700 players when i began at earlier stages). The guides are ok, but still not very helpful considering the weapons depend on your playing style (everyone has their own style). Also the "pride" high lvls have.. well kinda aholes if ya ask me. i seen unfairly balanced matches, all lv 1-5 in one team, and another team with lv 30-40 (several high lvls) just putting down new players making them hate this game to the guts. (an option to chose which lvls can join would be great).Always voting down when a vote for balance teams shows up (i also need mention, the game voting system is cmpletely broke. i have yet to see one day where it works).The need for 4 players min is horrible too. if i want to play with a friend, i cant since i need 4 players. making private 1-1 battles impossible. Also there is the vehicles and the lag these cause (barely anyone can drive those things without crashing. the vehicle engine (ragdoll effects and how it interacts and stuff) is pretty bad as well. my Car can drive over cars like a tank. the streest are really narrow, the stages feel cramped (try Office with 20 people for a size) and monaco is barely playable. its not all that bad, now attachments are rentable (next step, permanents), and the skins are more diverse (paytowin spoiler too), though impossible for normal players to get due to the $$$ cost rather than GP. Weapons (except snipers and shotguns) are a tad more balanced. (snipers are either OP or very crappy (like the initial sniper everyone gets.. i can get quicker kills with the initial pistol than with that sniper. and the AS50, the most OP gun in the world, especially for people with really low PING and FPS. *cough* or aimbots. Shotguns are all broken, the bullets dont spray much (especially on the autoshotgun) making it deadly and just ridiculously op to the point of making half a team quit and the other half quit due to being outnumbered (seen it). As mentioned earlier, bots would be a great addition, allowing players to practice alone at the cost of 0 GP (or maybe a GP reduction depending on the ammount of players on like.. maybe player kills count and bots dont or something) or to fill up stages (many cases of making a match when all are full and nobody joining). some more mechanics like this would be great. The recoil is still as high as ever, but i guess that is what makes the game somewhat (since there aint ironsights or anything). The game is "alright" but until there are more players and the VAC is set up, i would NOT reccomend this game myself. Kudos and hope someday TI will carry forward, right? Anyways.. thats more my line of thinking. The dev's aint to blame either, i think they done a great job with each update (really seen lots of improvement). Just hope the community gets looked over.UPDATE: JIM ITS DEAD.. The games dead dont even bother downloading this. Only EU servers left and the admins dont give a fk anymore. After they changed (Now to FixGames, who apperently dont fix a♥♥♥♥♥♥.) it just got worse and worse. I got atleast 10 pictures of different ingame bugs and glitches. Ignore what is above this, its just dead.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												Hmmm, I have an urge to bash this game and say it is a blatent ripoff off of Counter Strike. But in all honesty, that doesn't do the game any justice. It has the same features as Counter Strike but how you play and what you do will greatly affect your experience. First of all, Graphically, it uses the Source engine so the graphics are decent but defineatly not great. On my machine at max settings, textures have the same resolution as a Minecraft block. Furthermore, the animations are stiff and unrealistic. However, just like in Counter Strike shooting is good. You have 3 default weapons which are all good and balanced well and even the shotgun doesn't seem overpowered. The maps are fairly large with open space and little nooks and crannies. Most maps are designed for 6v6 gameplay although some maps are big enough to hold 24 players. There are the standard TDM but there is an interesting gamemode called Highway. As the name suggests you drive a car and shoot people in other cars and retrive the intel. Nothing in this game is unique but it is not supposed to. It is simply a F2P Counter Strike. However with all the problems the game has I would rather buy a $20 game like Counter Stike because it would provide a  better experience. Oh, did I mention the screen shake? But to be fair, you get enjoyement when you play this game, which is why my final veredict for this game is a 7/10

content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												This game is amazing just like counter strike it is hip fire and really well done. The problem is with this game is the lack of game modes but as patches for a new UI and modes with new maps (without DLC) this makes for a great free to play experince. Yet I'm a little mad at the devopers that they made better guns but having to pay with real money but it's okay because the guns are banlced. Other problems are that ingame money is hard to get but this also makes the guns less op yet it's still fustrating because the guns are just so good. But after all the problems with this game it's amazing and free so download it and be happy you did. (P.S. Careful Mac users your game will crash during loading maps due to the new update.)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
												As i looked through the reviews before  i downloaded this game on my pc, i was a little turned off at the comments said about this game, but when i played all my doubts disappeard. Its true that this game does not have the best graphics, or the best engine in genral, but i think thats not a fair way to judge any game, what matters is the gameplay, and the concept. this game has a very simler feel to counter strike 1.6, but with a little more added features like the lean or the role, but ignore those details because those are things you need to try for yourself to understand weather you like it or not. The main issue that people have with this game is the pay for guns, where in order to buy guns you either play for a long time just to bearly make enough for one gun, or spend real money which is around a doller or two, but when you first start out you are givin enough points to buy any gun of your choosing, and you can afford just about anyone you prefer. I know the pay for guns is usually an issue for people, but remember this game is free, and the creators have to have a way to make money, and i think a doller for a gun you can own permenantly is a fair amount. This game has multiple modes: my favorite  is the vip escort which is where you have to escort a vip in a car and you get chased by terroists, you have team deathmatch, hostage rescue, and demolition. The other issue that people have is the small communtiy, yes it is very small, but enough for you to join a lobby, and play a full game with enough people, and the best part is the community in this game are pretty nice. over all i think that you should download this game, and give it a shot sense its free, and you can uninstall it anytime, but when you play, dont play with the mentalty of thinking your going to be the god of war, and then rage everytime someone kills you, but instead play with the intention to have fun, and laugh everytime you get a kill or get killed because i guarantee you'll see this game the same way i do.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												Currently, I'm rank 16, and I've killed exactly 8712 other players, and have died 7622 times. I've won 196 matches, and have lost only 154 in comparison. The game in itself is strenuously challenging, but not impossible. I'm tempted to say that it's difficult to cope with at times, and is not for everyone. You need to be able to react fast, and build a common strategy as to how you'll get your next kill in. Spawn points are ridiculous, but it often favors random parties. Same goes to individuals, too. There's people who like to complain a lot by the way, about choice weapons, such as shotguns or the often spotted P90. It's mostly fun, though, to watch them ramble on and on about that last headshot you got in on them. All in all, noobs will be owned, but you can still easily work your way up with experience, and of course, the GP you earn with every match helps tremendously. Just be sure not to stray away from the shop. One can easily earn the necessary armor and weapons for more comfortable gameplay, or just flat out buy it with cold, hard cash, for not everything can be purchased with GP. At the same time, it doesn't take forever to save up GP either. As far as developing one's inventory goes, to each their own. One shouldn’t complain about another’s fix.

												This game is a giant parody of every "serious" FPS on the marketIt takes its art style from CounterStrike, adds the paid DLC that borders on ridiculous from CoD,and uses a few metric tons of nonsense from Battlefield Hardline.Almost everyone who didn't recommend this game either expected something similar to one ofthe annual Treyarch games or is merely trolling.If you demand being able to 360noscope, rek scrubs, or are just a gigantic tryhard in general, look elsewhere.If you want a game you can hop in and play with your friends at 2 in the morning and laugh at the insanity,this game is for you.It's like the party game of the FPS genre. 8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 10, 2016
												I hope this review is seen by T.I,This game has a wealth of potential, its Highway mode map is very fun and I am not going to lie, I have laughed my♥♥♥♥♥♥off at the randomness of it and the physics.. I am actually laughing now because it is so .. over the top.But there are moments when you are driving, pursuit, leaning out of the car window and feeling so damn cool.. But then it all goes to hell quickly.Things I would like to see improve are:1. Ingame menu. This could use a complete visual update, it looks like it has not been developed.2. Animations. The animations are quite cooky. A lot of jumping around, hopping about and while I appreciate that enemies should animate to represent low health.. I would like to see the pantomine jumping/hopping redesigned... It is cringeworthy.3. Physics and speed. The game feels very raw, especially when leaving a car or crashing etc.. The speed of it all is way too unpolished and could use some more realism overall.4. Textures, the guns are nice. (The fantasy knife is silly though). But if the car dashboards could be made to look nicer this sort of stuff would improve the game inmeasurably.. There are a lot of pointy edges on textures which is really wrong in a game made in the 2010's and onwards.. If the textures and models could get better updates to look much better then this would rocket with users.Basically the cringe worthiness would be reduced .. I say start with the ingame menu and spectator like stuff because that would be easiest? quickest and most effective as the current score card system looks like it was left to rot in a basement and forgotten about.Will download this and play again as I want to support this project, it has so much potential.. CS and Cars is EPIC and FEELS EPIC... Time to polish the chassis now and tune up the suspension I think lads!Catharsis

content:
Posted: April 23
												I have only played this game for 17 hours(currently as of writing this), but I can say that it feels like a lot more! Tactical Intervention is a Free-To-Play game running off of the Source engine, the same engine that runs Counter-Strike, Team-Fortress, and other multiplayer Valve games. When playing Tactical Intervention, you can tell that the game's developers were inspired by Counter-Strike. You will however run into small bugs and glitches while playing, but Tactical Intervention is still receiving updates. I recommend this game because it is fun to play and it still gives off a nice, overhauled Counter-Strike feel!

content:
Posted: May 16, 2014
												In my opinion, Tactical Intervention is a very good and detailed game. It offers you to challenge the terrorists while being the police and the same about being a terrorist. From a variety of gamemodes and missions, you can choose to protect areas, people and things to trying to get as many kills as possible in a TDM Match. All of this is offered for free with no sort of in game payments. Ofcourse, you can skip a few hours of trying to unlock a weapon by simply paying £2.The overall system of the game is very good. Obviously, because this is an older game, the graphics aren't great. The game "hawken" surely can't be beaten in graphics by any game. Even a game as good as this.The buttons are fairly easy to get used to with the default keys to move as "W,A,S,D" and the mouse to "aim" and "fire." In my opinion, after a year of playing Minecraft, i changed the shift key to the crouch button because its my natrual idea for crouching and my natural movement od my hand when attempting to crouch. To roll out of an enemys line of site press "x." The roll key is very useful when trying to get out of any line of site but also is annoying when you jump of a 1ft tall wall and you automatically roll into an enemys sniper bullet.Being a huge Call Of Duty fan, i am used to "annoying" snipers and trickshotters, slowly swarming over the Call Of Duty franchise. The only game that wasn't as bad was "World Of War." In this game, snipers can take up to 4 bullets to kill. Exactly like "BattleField 2-3." I like this aspect because its real war and it matters how good you are; not how lucky you are.Overall, this game is very good. I give it an 8/10. If the graphics were improved in a newer version, im sure this could be a competition for some well-know franchises.- Mason Firman | CEO Of Many Websites.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												While this game wasn't a big hit, it has a certain charm to it that has kept me coming back. A friend recommended it to me and I was skeptical at first, but after playing a while I found I really enjoyed it. I also found out that a lot of what people say about it is wrong. First, it is not pay to win, and the grinds for guns are hardly long at all, compared to other online games.Secondly, I realize that it is fairly cheaply made, but for free? You can hardly beat that. The only things that cost money only are skins, which do nothing. I have not spent a cent on this game, and yet I am just about to purchase the most expensive weapon.Thirdly, the gamemodes are fun, especially the vip escort missions, which usually end up looking wacky and hilarious. Their is a moderate team element to this game as well, so that is always nice to know.Lastly, I was looking for a simple mmofps that wasn't pay to win and consistently fun, this was it.The only downside to this game is that it is filled with children who spam the mic and complain, but you can always mute them, and airheads who think they are immortals among men. However, these problems typically pollute every online game. Overall, it is a fun, free experience, and I intend on playing it for a long time, try it before you judge!

Posted: May 16, 2014
												In my opinion, Tactical Intervention is a very good and detailed game. It offers you to challenge the terrorists while being the police and the same about being a terrorist. From a variety of gamemodes and missions, you can choose to protect areas, people and things to trying to get as many kills as possible in a TDM Match. All of this is offered for free with no sort of in game payments. Ofcourse, you can skip a few hours of trying to unlock a weapon by simply paying £2.The overall system of the game is very good. Obviously, because this is an older game, the graphics aren't great. The game "hawken" surely can't be beaten in graphics by any game. Even a game as good as this.The buttons are fairly easy to get used to with the default keys to move as "W,A,S,D" and the mouse to "aim" and "fire." In my opinion, after a year of playing Minecraft, i changed the shift key to the crouch button because its my natrual idea for crouching and my natural movement od my hand when attempting to crouch. To roll out of an enemys line of site press "x." The roll key is very useful when trying to get out of any line of site but also is annoying when you jump of a 1ft tall wall and you automatically roll into an enemys sniper bullet.Being a huge Call Of Duty fan, i am used to "annoying" snipers and trickshotters, slowly swarming over the Call Of Duty franchise. The only game that wasn't as bad was "World Of War." In this game, snipers can take up to 4 bullets to kill. Exactly like "BattleField 2-3." I like this aspect because its real war and it matters how good you are; not how lucky you are.Overall, this game is very good. I give it an 8/10. If the graphics were improved in a newer version, im sure this could be a competition for some well-know franchises.- Mason Firman | CEO Of Many Websites.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												While this game wasn't a big hit, it has a certain charm to it that has kept me coming back. A friend recommended it to me and I was skeptical at first, but after playing a while I found I really enjoyed it. I also found out that a lot of what people say about it is wrong. First, it is not pay to win, and the grinds for guns are hardly long at all, compared to other online games.Secondly, I realize that it is fairly cheaply made, but for free? You can hardly beat that. The only things that cost money only are skins, which do nothing. I have not spent a cent on this game, and yet I am just about to purchase the most expensive weapon.Thirdly, the gamemodes are fun, especially the vip escort missions, which usually end up looking wacky and hilarious. Their is a moderate team element to this game as well, so that is always nice to know.Lastly, I was looking for a simple mmofps that wasn't pay to win and consistently fun, this was it.The only downside to this game is that it is filled with children who spam the mic and complain, but you can always mute them, and airheads who think they are immortals among men. However, these problems typically pollute every online game. Overall, it is a fun, free experience, and I intend on playing it for a long time, try it before you judge!

												     It's really fun, though there are a lot of things that they need to fix. Let me show you the reasons of, "I like this" and "They need to fix this."I like this:1. It's really fun once you know the controls2. VIP Escort.3. Awesome firstperson view4. The DLC, you don't have to buy it. There are GPs (Game points) that you can get for playing.5. Dogs. (Sadly, Husky's only in the DLC ;-; Why...)They need to fix this:1. VOICE ACTING.2. In VIP Escort, as a passenger,  Very buggy when someone's driving3. Models and Graphics could be better, they look like they're from CS:S4. Who makes a trailer that looks like it's awesome?     So, it's fun (What I think.). Think about it, besides, your not wasting any money by buying this. Hope this was helpful!

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												i just tried hard to like this game.. but it had nothing tactical and certainly nothing to do with cs. i was thrown in some kind of shooter game, where everyone seems to be your enemy and friendly fire even gives you some extra points.. just shoot at all and everything that moves. can't see anything tactical about this. and not very satisfactory to me, like there won't be a yes, we are a good team and that's why we won this round. why are there teams at all to start with? maybe i just got to the bad servers over and over, but everywhere i joined a game, it was like that. just because it's free doesn't mean it hasn't to make sense.. deleted from harddisk.. will certainly drop by again in future, maybe the name of the game will swap over into actual gameplay. however i prefer to stick to cs for now. and yes why not, payday.. those games actually let me feel that i'm playing a real tactical game. as said, i don't condemn this game, maybe it will become better, but for now it's even worse than team fortress (which i actually had paid for before it became free), at least there you have teams and also get that sense of running around like mad funny chickens shooting at all your enemies. still you've got a team and you can win, what actually gives you a sense of acomplishing something.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												this game is simultaneously bad and goodits a free to play lobby based korean counter-strike clone (pretty much CS:GO except with a 1.6 feel)good because of its simplicity and rewarding gameplay; you shoot a guy, you get a pleasant THUD sound of it hitting their body, and people generally die when you get the drop on them. its a game that rewards fps experience, instead of trying to pull the rug out on you. this is also a source engine game so the engine physics should be familiar to anyone who has played counter-strike. bad also because of its simplicity, because really, it looks like♥♥♥♥♥♥ the animations are silly as ♥♥♥♥, the interface is amateurish, the whole thing seems janky and held together with duct tape--- but it works. it's just not that polished AAA visual experience that all modern shooters strive to be these days. also the playerbase kindof sucks. being a free to play game its plagued with underexperienced and underaged kids and you often find yourself on a team full of them. also you only get to pick from 3 guns at the start. everything else you have to purchase with ingame earned points or cash money. (which really isnt a problem since ttk is low enough nothing really feels unfair)i have fun playing this stupid game because its a fun stupid game. why dont i just play counter-strike? i dunno, im kindof burned on counterstrike and you cant HOLD YOUR GUN IN THE AIR ABOVE YOUR HEAD like you can in this game. that feature aloneALSO YOU CAN DRIVE CARS AROUND PWSSH CRASH BOOM BAMtldr play this ♥♥♥♥ing game i dont care if you think it looks like♥♥♥♥♥♥its better and more fun than planetside 2

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												This was my re indoctrination to pc after I went to consoles in 2004. And man I am glad it was the game to bring me and my shiny new pc. So your a console noob I hear you yell. My answer, was. So what gives me the right to tell you about this being a good game and definitely worth your time? Well the 440 hours as of current, the fact I learned how the hell I am supposed to use all my fingers but my thumbs, a polar opposite to a controller which is both thumbs n two fingers. And finally the fun and laughter I have shared with this great games awesome community. Now I'll be honest my view on this game is bias because if you spend 440 hours in something of course you defend the reason. So yes I have on my rose tinted glasses. But I will be honest about the game to the best of my ability. So I got my new PC and spent way too much on it. So now I look at the game distribution platforms and I know steam to be the biggest and most well know. Downloaded. Next what can I afford on steam? Shakes out pockets... damn no money. Ah a free to play tab, now we are talking. Scrolls through a small list... hm Tactical Intervention. Downloads. Installs. Boots up. Play button. Server browser,  EU 120 players excellent.  Now I sit in a lobby presented with two options. Mission or TDM. Well I wasn't a fan of call of dutys TDM so ill go mission sounds interesting.  Whats WASD? Fk me my♥♥♥♥♥was handed to me so many times by some germans who were high rank with damn good guns. But I get the odd kill and have a good laugh and my shizness at keyboard, failing to hit keys, missing shift and control. Over the next month of November I practise and learn and well I also found driving maps. BEST TIME I EVER HAD! Seriously if you get this game just for the driving its good. Any way as December came I was a adept keyboard user. I could control everything confidently and I had reacged out from driving to bombing and hostage rescue. I was noob no more being on posotive k/d s and man skyrise is fun rapelling with my hard earned p90 I got from driving. TI was good. A few months down the road EU 1 was a barren wasteland and at 11pm GMT it was a ghost town. So I reached out to the 250 in USA to get my drinvg fix and around feburary I had run across some TI regulars by the names of Waxychicken and greengo. Im level 20 at this point with 120 hours on record still doubtful of my skill on a keyboard and let slone gameplay. However they had the lobby down to four on four. And they suggested a scrim with me against them with the 3 I didn't know. I thought we were doomed.  However to my surprise through hard work learning keyboard controls and through are somehow coheasive team we manage a draw. Suddenly I feel at equals to some of the best players on the game.Throughout the next year of 2014 we met up at around 1am gmt and play mission modes, meeting the wider ti community from the expanse to gamer junkies, ger-ti, aq to name a few clans out there with me still popping in to the now 90 EU1 when available. Now this is what made TI great. It always provided fair fun and amusement to me. And so here is my intro for PCNow here is why I recommend it:1. Free to play, and easy to get you started on pc games in the future2.good mechanics and a solid game3.is updated and still with developer support which would be omega and cohort. 4. The community is active and very friendly5.plenty to choose from. Now 5 modes with corrosponding map variety. 6. Doesn't require a pc as expensive as mine to run7.  Most importantly it damn good fun!Now of recent its run into the odd issue like only EU/RUS servers and the performance issues for weaker pcs im told. Obviously not everything can feel balanced, the graphics aren't that of a AAA title (I think it gives it a unique charm tbh) the voice acting is weak for some voice packs but great for some, please jump off a building and laugh at that screaming asthey fall its just 10/10. Unlike the im dying and certain hostage talk. Though there statements are funny.Any way try it its free. The only thing you stand to loose is shizzle loads of time. Comfortability as you laugh so hard it hurts, maybe the odd £ $ ¥ € ₩ etc if you buy a skin pack to look badass and maybe your dignity as you crash into every damb lampost as we yell at you for being a bad driver while taking a terrorist car to the♥♥♥♥♥:D

content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
												It's got potential, but I'm not seeing it at all right now. It's a "Pay to Win" kind of f2p game. I come from a TF2 and Dota 2 background where you don't need to spend any money at all to be good at the game. The fact that I have to pay tons of games to earn game points, only to realize that I can only have that gun for a week just sucks. Everything costs so much, and requires dedication to play this kind of game, All mannerisms of customization is cool, but when those customations actually alter gameplay aside from the guns bothers me. A guy who's really good at the game gets rewarded, whereas other players who aren't the best get punished by low gamepoints, leading in no helmets, guns, kevlar vests, or even a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ dog. I'm still torn on this game. It's kind of fun, but I'm still not seeing it as the next Counter-Strike.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												This game is the typical generic FPS we all love and hate at the same time. Some maps are nicely done, but the weapon recoil is really unpredictable and hard to control, so gameplay can become frustrating. You can roll in any direction to evade shots, explosives, etc, but it feels really weird and sloppy. The default weapons aren't balanced at all, they are very bad, like usual with F2P games. The good thing is that you can buy permanent weapons with in-game currency, but assuming you don't play 6 hours a day, it can take a long time to get enough money to buy a single weapon.The only interesting thing are the driving maps, but again, they are not well executed. The driving is cool at first, but it gets annoying fast, because car controls and physics are awful. The rescue missions are fun and the rappel and dog mechanics are nice additions, though. There are "kill streaks" too in the form of special grenades. It's always fun to burn multiple people at once with an incendiary grenade you just got magically. XDI would only recommend this if you don't own Counter Strike yet, because it's a superior game in every way.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2014
This game is alot like Counter-Strike. No, forget that. It IS Counter-Strike! This game is so much like it, I could remove that CS game from my wishlist. This game was $0.00. However, the game on my wishlist (CS:GO) is $19.99. IT'S THE SAME GAME, so I would rather this game and this is why:StoryGameplay: 8-10This game has a built-in radar system that detects moving enemies. It also has a cool feature to highlight who your friends are (yellow) and just ordinary players (green). The mechanics of the game run fairly smoothly on the lowest res and graphics and also the rolling mechanic is a dream if you want to relocate efficiantly and quickly and as a followup, you can lean and blindfire. Which blindfiring can get you killed more easily and I never use it. A flaw of this game is it's squeakers. And squealers. This is multiplayer and this flaw falls under gameplay because you get killed when squeakers rage on the mic. And♥♥♥♥♥♥♥if squealers rage on the mic.  Graphics: 9-10It COULD be a little better due to the source-like graphics content. But it is a great look. This game allows you to immerse yourself into the tactical methods to take out your enemy. I have every thing punched and wound down in the settings though because I'll lag otherwise. But I'll take your word for it in the comments if any graphics are suitable. I will change the rating accordingly. Controls: 9-10I would give it this score except for one flaw: The talk key is bound by default to... gawsh can't even THINK about it... "k"! OH MY GOD! WHO WOULD REACH THEIR HAND WAY THE **** ACROSS THE KEYBOARD TO COMMUNICATE WITH THEIR FRIENDS?! I have no clue WHY I am *****ing about this because you can change it. Also, I recommend that you bind Primary to c, Secondary to V, Rolling to X, and knife to Z. This way, you don't have to reach the # keys. And you know which one's which. There's also a range of stuff up in the gameplay stuff too that are controls worthy but I won't explain them. Sound: 10-10It sounds like an actual warfare/counter-terrorism act. This will also help immerse yourself into this. The weapons sound fairly... worn in sound to put it mildly (that's badish). The rolling sounds awesome though. And, when you hit someone, it makes a gibblet bursting sound (if you don't know what "gibblet" is, look it up). It's really nasty. Replay Value Overall Rating Value: 9.595-10This game is a cool game and is JUST LIKE CS. So I would reccomend this to my friends and to anyone who reads this if you are the one to take up the Tactical action (no pun intended). Also, Bewary of the squeaker that thinks he's the best at TI. I have him linked in my group in trollable people. So just have fun.

												As a game that was created by "Gooseman", one of the co-creators of Counter-Strike, you'd think a mind like his would spawn something as fun and challenging as said game... Well, you'd be wrong.The game in its current state, with the old F2P cliche of being handed the worst guns in the game and a not-at-all outstanding gameplay despite the creative and often-tactical features (such as rappelling or using an attack dog), is absolute garbage. I'd recommend staying away from the game unless you're thinking of forking out some money to skip the rage-inducing starters. Money that'd be better spent on something else.

content:
Posted: January 12
												It's very mediocre at best.-Hit detection is shoddy.Your chance to hit someone is pretty rare unless you are in melee range, and even then it is a crapshoot whether or not your 30 round clip will register a single solitary hit against your enemy.-Damage you do seems to be completely random.From what I've seen, the difference in how much damage you do per shot fluctuates randomly, you can fire at an enemy from a certain distance and kill them in a couple shots the first time around with headshots, and the next time you see them you can hit them an upwards of 5-9 times from the same HP to actually kill them as opposed to the 2 needed before, there is no consistency (Tested with standing targets at the same distance with the same health, and the same weapon with similar latency between players)-Paying to unlock items way beyond your level that can still be used against new players.Not going to say Pay to Win nescessarily, however it is a definite advantage over anyone using the lowest tier or starter weapons with absolutely no accuracy or damage output Vs. Mid to high tier weaponry (Provided the RNG damage is more likely in their favor)-Level designs are all over the place.Not to say they are horrible, just that they are a little too asymetrical. One side almost always has a clear advantage in terms of manuvering, cover and objective placement.-Highway modeIt's a fun gimmick, but ultimately with the rest of the mechanics of the game the driving novelty wears off once people have to start shooting again.Most I could rate it on a numerical scale would be 4/10It isn't Obscenely horrible, but it was a decent idea executed poorly.

number of helpful: 15 of 29 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 7, 2013
												The Desert.  Lost.  A familiar shape glimmers at the horizon.  Cactus?  Mirage?  A daunting march toward answers.  If real you could go blind slaking your thirst on its sap; you could die.  You might die before you reach it.  Will you die with dignity?  Desperation.  You approach the cactus and see that it is formed of old feces and the spines used needles.  A small clearing surrounds a slit on its trunk: a sap hole?  You grip carefully around the stained hypodermic barbs and, regretfully, push your tongue gingerly inside.  Something unusual--should this taste metallic?  As you recoil to inspect the area you notice the slit has relaxed; opened wider, you spot a glimmer inside and pull disquisitively at the opening.  Red and amber circles overlap above a narrow metal opening.  "Please insert card to purchase one squirt of sap."  And now... the choice.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2014
												Everyone has an opinion and interests in different games/genres but in spite of that, I have to give this game a definite thumbs down. Without some ridiculously large updating for basically every aspect of the game, I cannot reccommend this game to anyone....ever....period. I will hit on a few points that I think apply to any gamer regardless of preferences in game genres.GRAPHICS- Absolutely "so-so". Nothing beautiful or fancy here, regardless of the rig you might be equipped with.GAMEPLAY- Fairly confusing (especially to newcomers), annoying controls...not at all user friendly-even with a gamepad. STORYLINE- What storyline?CUSTOMIZATION- Mediocre at best, and thats only if you wanna pay for in-game items (IMO: seriously overpriced).UPDATES- I see that the developers have recently done some maintenance, after quite a bit of time. Regardles of what changes were mad, I don't believe there is any saving this game. OVERALL-It just doesn't have anything really good going for it to counteract all of the "bad" surrounding it. It would take a serious change for me to ever recommend or even play this game again. The bugginess and overwhelming amount of problems will keep me far far away from this title probably until it is put in it's well-deserved grave IMO. I would encourage you to make your own opinion, especially as this is a Free-To-Play game.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												The game is ment to be another Counter-Strike game and does furfil that promise, but nothing else.Games are laggy and teleportation often even when people have pings lower than 120 which is acceptable. The driving mode is unplayable. Cars pop in and out of view crashing into anything and everything. The other game modes cater to the high ping players making them bullet proof. The GP rate is much lower than it was in beta making buying perm weapons impossible, from 1000 GP to 150 GP that gap is massive.The game is also horribly optimized. At low settings i hardly scrape together 45 fps. I do play Mechwarrior Online, Left 4 Dead 2, Warframe, Combat Arms at decent settings and keeping above 50 fps with my budget video card. STEER CLEAR of this game until they fix it. Or better yet just get play a diffrent tactical game, this game is far from tactical.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												This game, though new, and basically a more modern take on counter strike (not surprising as the creator also work on CS), is  a good shooter. With two kinds of game modes, mission, which basically follows the same kinds of missions in CS, and a TDM mode that can sometimes make for good pick up gameplay & crazy fire-fights. Fighting focuses more on using cover and has leaning in it. Guns (aside from default ones) must be bought with Game points though, which is a downside. These and experiance points for the ranking system are gotten through gameplay, so the game is better for those who are dedicated gamer. Still is a great game, and is free, so I would  recomend a try out.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												Tactical Intervention is basically a free version of Counter Strike. But not as great, which is to be expected. This game is fully centered around multiplayer with several maps from cities to construction sites. This game also features abilities like hijacking a car, scaling down buildings, and my favourite, using innocent people as meat shields. There are many weapons throughout the game, most of which are unlockable through in-game currency. The thing is you can pay 1500 for a p90 for a day, or you could pay 35000 and get it permanately. Money is not hard to get, so 35000 is not some large impossible number to get to. I would definitely recommend this game for people who want a free CS-like game.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												This game, though new, and basically a more modern take on counter strike (not surprising as the creator also work on CS), is  a good shooter. With two kinds of game modes, mission, which basically follows the same kinds of missions in CS, and a TDM mode that can sometimes make for good pick up gameplay & crazy fire-fights. Fighting focuses more on using cover and has leaning in it. Guns (aside from default ones) must be bought with Game points though, which is a downside. These and experiance points for the ranking system are gotten through gameplay, so the game is better for those who are dedicated gamer. Still is a great game, and is free, so I would  recomend a try out.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												This game is amazing.Unlike most other Free 2 Play games with a shop system, you can actually be good at the game WITHOUT having a full wallet. You get 50k GP for starting out (the game's currency) which you can spend on guns, and equipment. The only item you have to buy with real money are character skins, which are useless and don't do anything, so it's optional.Unlike most FPS games where you can just run around and shoot, here you can run around and shoot, but loyal to the game's title, it is Tactical. You can roll (though it makes anyone dizzy) by pressing X, lean around corners by pressing Q or E, or press both to enter blind fire mode.Also, it's an FPS that supports teamwork. How? Being near your squad (you can pick either Alpha or Bravo, doesn't do much difference besides the fact that you get the following bonuses:) increases your accuracy, compared to if you're a lone wolf, and you can heal... other teamates. You can't heal yourself, which supports teamwork, as you'll need to be near teamates in order to stay alive.The game is pretty gory, which is nice, however, if you're a big baby who cries everytime they see pixelated blood in a video game, you can turn it off.Also, you can pick up fire extinguishers and blind enemies with them. 10/10 would play again

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2014
												Everyone has an opinion and interests in different games/genres but in spite of that, I have to give this game a definite thumbs down. Without some ridiculously large updating for basically every aspect of the game, I cannot reccommend this game to anyone....ever....period. I will hit on a few points that I think apply to any gamer regardless of preferences in game genres.GRAPHICS- Absolutely "so-so". Nothing beautiful or fancy here, regardless of the rig you might be equipped with.GAMEPLAY- Fairly confusing (especially to newcomers), annoying controls...not at all user friendly-even with a gamepad. STORYLINE- What storyline?CUSTOMIZATION- Mediocre at best, and thats only if you wanna pay for in-game items (IMO: seriously overpriced).UPDATES- I see that the developers have recently done some maintenance, after quite a bit of time. Regardles of what changes were mad, I don't believe there is any saving this game. OVERALL-It just doesn't have anything really good going for it to counteract all of the "bad" surrounding it. It would take a serious change for me to ever recommend or even play this game again. The bugginess and overwhelming amount of problems will keep me far far away from this title probably until it is put in it's well-deserved grave IMO. I would encourage you to make your own opinion, especially as this is a Free-To-Play game.

content:
Posted: March 18, 2014
												I believe T.I. is essentially good a Counter Stike rip-off, however i think most people who play this, myself included, accept that it is such and continue to have fun with it because we're a bunch of stingy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who have trouble taking the padlocks off our wallets.  That said, T.I. does incorporate some interesting features that C.S. does not have such as (correct me if i'm wrong) driving and everything having to do with driving gamemodes, rappelling, leaning around corners, and lets not forget the ability to "do a barrel roll" to name some.  One more criticism is that the in game currency takes ages to earn (its slightly pay to win).  I've played for many an hour and only managed to rack up enough moolah to purchase an smg.  To be fair, weapons can be rented for cheaper.  Also, recoil is a bit high, but i've grown to like it.  I would rather fire a weapon in a video game with realistic recoil than one that has been dampened to almost none *cough cough C.o.D*.  In all, I think T.I. does have its downfalls, but it includes enough new and interesting aspects of gameplay to make it a worthwhile, fun way to waste time and keep in mind, its pricetag is $0.00.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Free to Play, Asian style. That's how you sum this game up.Do not get it mixed up with "Pay 2 Win", if you work hard and save, you get to sit back and enjoy. Don't buy the silly temp rentals. Save, and buy perm weapons and items. Boots, holsters, "pets", skins, weapons... All of them can change the game play.Maps are tactical, charging in doesn't work all the time. Knowing how other people play, that's what makes you win.If I had to hand out "best free military fps", that would be TI. Nothing comes close for military FPSes. Being on Steam is a big bonus. No launchers or other junk!7/10

content:
Posted: November 20, 2013
												Tactical Intervention is refreshingly different from most team based FPSs out there. It has a strong emphasis on team play and can be very rewarding when working together with friends and others. The veteran FPS players will find many familiar aspects with new, unique twists. While offering many game modes that each offer unique experiences, my favorite at the moment is the VIP car escort missions. For me, driving in TI with friends can be as satisfying as playing pocket Medic in TF2 with some friends. There is a great sense of comradery and enjoyment that surpasses the competitive aspect of it and really shows what these types of games are about.I encourage all that appreciate team cooperation and coordination to give this game a go, you are bound to find players that share the same passion, and if you are looking for such players hit me up to give it a go :D

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2013
												Pretty fun game. It's somewhat Pay2Win seeing as how it takes forever to earn in-game currency and seems like there's those few people who spend $20-30 just to get some of the most powerful weapons in the game. But aside from that, all guns and most equipment can be purchased with the in-game currency. The game is pretty unique in how there's leaning, rolling and a radar based on sound made in a radius around your character. The game is also rewards you for sticking with your team as it gives you better accuracy/stability when near teammates. Also not the mention the Highway level which is a car chase. (Kinda hard to explain it, But it's really fun.) I would recommend giving this game a try, it can be hard at first but once you get the hang of the controls and get used to using lean and rolling, it can be a very fun game.

content:
Posted: December 13, 2015
												I was planning on writing a long, drawn-out review for this game. Instead I'll just give the TL;DR version.Pros: There are definitely guns. Uninstall may just work.Cons: Clunky aiming. Clunky movement, and useless sprint. Weapons have absolutely no weight or feel to them. Default weapons are awful. The gore is used horribly. Animations are stiff. Sound-design is sketchy. Sometimes locks you out of certain graphics options. NO FOV SLIDER (Seriously) No Dubstep during combat. No bikini-clad women running around the maps with dragon-painted AK's. Cannot turn off bloom/HDR/other lighting devices. I have not seen a single Gooseman yet. Actually made me use humor in a review. Ew. You have to buy helmets for operators (who should--presumably--have them standard issue). No. US. Servers. Bland design. Guns feel like they should all have ADS, but they shoot like they shouldn't. See the problem? It's in my Steam Library.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												So, here is the successor to Counter-Strike: Global Offensive from the developers of the CS series themselves. In short, I don't think so and here's why:- the quality of the game feels a bit underwhelming like it was given a low budget to work with ranging from animation, sound, voice acting, and graphics (don't really mind the graphics that much)- controls feel a little bit clunky, but I usually get used to games with clunky controls for some random reason (unless it's at the point where the game is considered to be unplayable)- in addition to clunky controls, the recoil of the guns are pretty strong to the point where it gives me a headache when I hold down the trigger of an assault rifleSo, those are the main reasons why it feels like a Half-Life 2 mod to me, but here is why I think the game is still fun regardless of how bad it is:- the stupidity: what I mean is that on how bad it feels, especially the voices coming out of their mouths is pretty funny for me if not annoying for most people- the VIP Escort mode: arguably the best game mode in the game because of how ridiculous the driving is- they did add in a couple of mechanics like leaning and combat rolling for your pleasure, even though I forget it exists for some odd reason All I can say now is that this game is not the true successor to CS: GO, but it's still fun regardless of the negativity people say.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												This game is very intriguing to me.  It starts you off against other players. Sometimes those players are very good, you will curse 50 times or more in the same match and you will call people hackers.  I've been there.  The intriguing part about this game, I think, is the rank system.  It is a very good measure of your skill, assuming you arn't a veteran with a new account. My point for bringing that up is if you play for the first time and you don't like it but you don't have the patience to learn the game and gradually get better then this game is definitely not for you.So instead of telling you all the great things the game has to offer, let me give a couple tippers that has helped me along. Finding the right gun for you is very important. I went the easy route at first and just looked for the most expensive items, then I got a little more interested in weapons with better stability, because those guns arn't going to bounce around quite so much when you shoot them. Crouching improves aim, shoot in sperts- particularly when aiming far away, and be mindful of your cross hairs. They will help indicate how accurate you are going to be (Without the scope attachments). Another big thing I find incredibly helpful: Play with earphones, keep your area as quiet as you can, and listen for the things your radar does not pick up. One more: Sneaking helps a ton; obvious, I know.  Run when you need to get from point A to B quickly, but when you know or even just suspect that someone might be around the corner, sneaking helps.  You might be able to throw them off your trail and get the jump on them first. It won't always work, but it will help you considerably in staying alive and even get you a little oomph in your accuracy.So this game has a lot of potential, and they are still adding stuff to it.  We got a new beta map and a couple new beta game modes just a week or two ago from this review. Most of the community is pretty cool too, and I will look forward to seeing you play.  = )Hope to see you there.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												First of all, if I wanted to play a game like this that not only has the same everything (minus the fire extingusher, dogs, ect.), but actually runs on my Vista at more than 10 fps, I'LL JUST THROW IN THE $19.99 FOR CS:SOURCE! Hell, I could buy CS:GO for $14.99....Pretty much what this is is a F2P, P2W CS:GO made to look pretty. Same weapons, models, even still goes by the Source physics engine. Plus, you could either pay the 14 dollars up front for CS:GO or pay the same amount just on weapons so you don't die every 5 seconds from people who have put $100+ into the game.In other words, don't waste your time. Go play one of the CS games. They're better.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 13, 2015
												I was planning on writing a long, drawn-out review for this game. Instead I'll just give the TL;DR version.Pros: There are definitely guns. Uninstall may just work.Cons: Clunky aiming. Clunky movement, and useless sprint. Weapons have absolutely no weight or feel to them. Default weapons are awful. The gore is used horribly. Animations are stiff. Sound-design is sketchy. Sometimes locks you out of certain graphics options. NO FOV SLIDER (Seriously) No Dubstep during combat. No bikini-clad women running around the maps with dragon-painted AK's. Cannot turn off bloom/HDR/other lighting devices. I have not seen a single Gooseman yet. Actually made me use humor in a review. Ew. You have to buy helmets for operators (who should--presumably--have them standard issue). No. US. Servers. Bland design. Guns feel like they should all have ADS, but they shoot like they shouldn't. See the problem? It's in my Steam Library.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2013
												Pretty fun game. It's somewhat Pay2Win seeing as how it takes forever to earn in-game currency and seems like there's those few people who spend $20-30 just to get some of the most powerful weapons in the game. But aside from that, all guns and most equipment can be purchased with the in-game currency. The game is pretty unique in how there's leaning, rolling and a radar based on sound made in a radius around your character. The game is also rewards you for sticking with your team as it gives you better accuracy/stability when near teammates. Also not the mention the Highway level which is a car chase. (Kinda hard to explain it, But it's really fun.) I would recommend giving this game a try, it can be hard at first but once you get the hang of the controls and get used to using lean and rolling, it can be a very fun game.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 20, 2013
												Tactical Intervention is refreshingly different from most team based FPSs out there. It has a strong emphasis on team play and can be very rewarding when working together with friends and others. The veteran FPS players will find many familiar aspects with new, unique twists. While offering many game modes that each offer unique experiences, my favorite at the moment is the VIP car escort missions. For me, driving in TI with friends can be as satisfying as playing pocket Medic in TF2 with some friends. There is a great sense of comradery and enjoyment that surpasses the competitive aspect of it and really shows what these types of games are about.I encourage all that appreciate team cooperation and coordination to give this game a go, you are bound to find players that share the same passion, and if you are looking for such players hit me up to give it a go :D

content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												Tactical Intervention has some wonderful game play. Whilst it's development team is small, they are also dedicated.You won't see numbers like CS, you won't see a a big team. But you will see a team filled with love for their jobs and passion. You'll see a diverse set of maps and game modes which allow for many different styles of game play.Most of all however, you'll see some wonderfully executed concepts for the game.My only criticisms are that of the payment model and the communication from the publishers (not the developers).Give it a go! And give it some training time.

												I sexually identify as the FitnessGram Pacer Test. Ever since I was a kid I dreamed of being an multi stage aerobic capacity test that progressively get more difficult as it continues. People tell me that a person can´t be a school fitness test but I don´t care, I´m beautiful. Every morning I wake up and tell myself "The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds". My running speed starts slowly but gets faster every minute. In school, every time I hear the bell I think "A single lap should've been completed, and if It isn't completed twice the test is over". From now on I want you guys to call me Fitness Gram and respect my right to run in a straight line and run as long as possible. content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												I started playing it about two months ago and so far I have had more fun than any other shooter recently. It feels solid and I like the driving missions and being able to use my dog in certain levels as well. I went ahead and purchased all the DLC because I believe in the game and want to support and I like the custom accessories. All $76.39 well spent. I would recommand the game to anyone and I have been telling the members in our gaming community about Tactical Intervention. The only thing I wish would change(and has nothing to do with the product you put out) is the competition is most mostly a joke. I'm not talking about being average gaming joke. What I'm refering to are people who don't even know how to play video games it seems. I notice players asking how to get out of vehicles and some that don't even know what the WASD keys are for. If you want to have a good time with friends and enjoy Counter Strike style games than this is a title you can be prould to add to your library. The few times I do get some competition the game shines.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												A poorly executed game that claims to be "Counter-Strike's Superior" but nooooooo, this game has several flaws in it and here are the reasons why I hate this game:Pay To Win (P2W): Are you %!@$ing serious!? This feature has gone too far to the game itself, I don't want to waste my money over a gun that can kill almost anything but not a guy who have a LOT of stuff. It should just use the traditional $ to buy weapons via Buy Menu like in the Counter-Strike series...OP Shotguns: Am i playing CoD right now? AM I!? okay, here is the point, Ive seen a dude almost get a K/D ratio of 67/39 using a shotty itself, which is ridiculous. And for the fact that the pumping animation is SLOWER than any FPSes I've ever played, it took me about a second to fully pump a shotgun before returning fire.Laughable Animations: Heh, the player animations in this game are so laughable, they run like crabs with guns, the reloading animations are okay though, just the running and crouching animations are just meh, but this is just my least problem about the game.Characters look ugly as hell: ???, why is everyone look outdated and just retextured? Can't they just make a single character without looking like.... ripped off from a old game? Again my least problem from these reasons.Gameplay itself: Worse than idiots running around with shotguns in the game itself.Spawns: Oh hell no, TDM got the spawns similar to CoD's spawns... take this as an example: 2 Guys spawned, then a enemy spawns right behind them and he mowed them down using its OP Shotty or a powerful weapon...Weapons that obscure 50% of your screen: "Oh look, my gun is so big, I can't see♥♥♥♥♥♥on my screen, I'M DEAD!" Seriously, they just make the guns hideously giant to obscure your screen just to admire what your gun looks like, they should just make it smaller and less obscuring-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------And the only thing I like about this game was the:Gore: Hey, despite I don't like this game, they made the gore look satisfying. Instead the character's head stays there when it gets headshotted by a powerful weapon, it bursts into tiny pieces with blood all over.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Pros and ConsPros:  Captain Obvious much? Better than CoD          Good Maps          Gore Simulator with CTs and TsCons: Again, Captain Obvious. P2W          Bad TDM Spawns          Ugly looking characters          Animations that are the most laughable than any game.Overall Score: 15/100

Posted: May 24, 2015
												Reminds me a lot of those tactical mutators for unreal tournament 99 and it plays like one too.Graphics: Would have looked dated in 2004, doesnt look like a source game or take advantage of the engine.Audio: Meh, didnt leave much of an impression but wasnt noticeably bad either.Gameplay: Some of the gimmicks (human shields and vehicles) are interesting but poorly implemented, There is nothing particularly "tactical" about this game, its predominantly run and gun with no iron sights.Overall, a weak CS clone 15 years too late. Its free, but I dont consider it worth the effort when there are for more polished ftp multiplayer shooters available.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2013
												tactical intervention has lots of pontential, it just doesn't live up to it. it's a really fun game, but the controlls are awful. driving is so sensitive you usually get into a embarrassing crash that makes you  lose 15 seconds into getting into the car. the only 3 things i like about the cars is that they're stylish, you can break into pedestrians cars just like GTA only easier. and the third reason is that when you force pedestrians out of their car, they get to the ground with their hands over their heads. i usually kill them when they do that. also, you don't want to know how many times i entered a game so glitched that i slid (not walked), i stood still (while i slid) and i couldn't use any of my weapons. the game also has good things about it. it's really gory, and it's free to play! i'm talkin' gory-er than GTA! the fact that you could use people as meatshields and you could lean and shoot out of cars really got people exited, but there's draw-backs.for the meatshields, it doesn't protect your whole body, so you better hope your enemy isn't an accurate shooter. for the cars, your driver usually squishes you against a wall and kills you any way. the last thing is the shop. if your thinking about getting the game, listen to this before you waste your MB's and GB's: you can't buy things, you can only rent them. i mean you CAN buy things, but it costs 3 times as much as renting it, and even renting costs alot. i give a 8.5 out of 10. if you want to get a better free to play fps expierence, go for team fortress 2 ( i made a reccomendation for it. chek it out).
