content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
												Please read this review all the way through to understand why I don't recommend it.I heard about this game first on MMOhuts F2P FPS games on steam. Its main claim to fame was the fact that Goosemas one of the guys who worked on the original counter strike had helped create this. I looked trough some reviews (not Steam reviews) and thought it looked good so here were my first impressionsThe Technical stuffThis game runs off the source engine as you might expect. It's not breaking any grounds in sound design or its graphics. Gameplay offers a little variety with a mechanic that allows you to lean in an out of cover and to "blindshoot." If their are hostages on the map you cna use those as shields whitch is kinda cool. Stuff I like I like the roll and leaning mechanics and the guns are fun to use. Stuff I don't likeThis game is definitely pay to win and you can tell who dropped some cash in this game. The recoil shakes the screen LIKE YOU WOULDN'T BElIEVE. Hit detection is super hit and miss. The hud can be a littled cluttered at times and the community is hard to bear. I wouuld recommed this game to some one who wants to get "counter strike" but can't afford it. If you already have counter strike or don't want to bear a grind I DON'T recommend it. Sorry Goosemas they can't all be winners.

content:
Posted: April 27, 2014
												I honestly think that if the devs were to retitle this game as "Hollywood Car Chase Simulator 2014", this game would sell like hotcakes. Dead serious.Anyway, let's get on to the actual review: Tactical Intervention is an FPS that is quite ironically the least tactical game you will ever play. But does that make it bad? Of course not. Tactical Intervention has quite a few charm points, which I genuinely think you should try out at least once.THE GOOD:As stated in the title, Tactical Intervention features a car chase game mode, in which the Terrorist team is given 1-3 cars to chase after a Counter-Terrorist VIP, who is also in a car. The mode is hilariously glitchy, but in an incredibly fun way, as referenced by STAR_ in his "Tactical Intervention 1.6" video.Another thing I genuinely appreciate from the dev team is their attention towards the playerbase. A lot of people (myself included) complained about the recoil system in that it was too spazzy (your screen would literally shake up and down frantically as you fired). Within a month, they fixed the recoil system, so shoutout to FIX Korea for their totally bro devs!The guns in this game are something which I feel more game devs should take note of. All of the guns are very well balanced (with 1 or 2 outliers, but you can't be perfect), and each have a role- Sniper/Marksman Rifles are for Long Range, Assault Rifles are for Mid Range, SMGs are for Close Range, and Shotguns are for Point Blank. The guns have a customization system, allow you to purchase silencers, optics, compensators, flashlights, and weapon camos.Oh, and did I mention that this game does a great job of the whole F2P thing? The in game economy is similar to TF2, in that the only cash-only items in the game are character models and weapon skins.THE BAD:You probably only heard of Tactical Intervention because you clicked on the "Free-To-Play" section in the Steam Store. Well, that's another problem with TI. The playerbase is very, very, very small. The number of concurrent players is literally smaller than the entire population of Vatican City. Go ahead and take a moment to Google that if you wish. It's not uncommon to meet the exact same people day after day, and that means that if you happen to come upon a toxic player, guess what? You're probably gonna see them again before the day's over.I did say that most of the weapons in TI are well balanced, but there are some outliers. And quite frankly, those outliers are really damn powerful. The AS50, a semi-automatic .50 caliber anti-material rifle, has the ability to kill a player in one shot- yes, you read that correctly- to ANY part of the body (unless you buy armor, but most people don't know about the existence of armor). Sure, it has a ton of scope sway to compensate, but you can noscope with it very easily, making it a threat in CQC. Another unbalanced weapon is the M4 STAR 10, known commonly as the M4 Super 90. The Super 90 is a 12 guage, semi-automatic shotgun with a very high rate of fire, and an uncomfortably long range. Its running accuracy is damn high, too, meaning that you can literally bumrush a group of people face first, and probably kill them. All of them. What makes it worse is that all the guns in the game can be bought with IGC (in game currency), so your average noob can buy a Super 90 literally the moment he boots up the game (all players start with $50000, just enough to buy a Super 90)THE UGLY:As mentioned in the Bad section, the playerbase is very small. And I really don't mean to make fun of anyone by saying this, but 90% of players literally have no clue what they're doing. Like, if you go into an S&D server, you'll see people shooting at the bomb. Even if you tell them to hold down F. Which is another problem with the game- since its F2P, the vast majority of players are from BRIC (Brazil/India/Russia/China), or some equally foreign country like Poland or Peru. I don't know if it's out of ignorance or hatred or both, but pretty much no one speaks English, and some people will even go as far as to make fun of you for doing so. Which is ironic, since everyone plays on the AMERICAN servers. Speaking of servers, why do the non-americans play on American servers, and then complain about all the lag?!?! Like, go into your average lobby, and I guarantee at least 80% of the pings will be above 100.CONCLUSION:Don't take the game too seriously (or seriously at all, for that matter), and you'll be just fine. TI is a nice game to blow off some steam, but just like Quake, it's a minimalistic game, meaning there's no unlockables or anything like that, so don't be surprised if you quickly decide that you're bored of the game.6/10

Posted: April 24, 2014
												VERY FUN!  This highly addictive FPS from the creator of the Counter Strike Series is like the spiritual successor to the original games.  There are the classic game modes we know and love: Bomb Defusal and Hostage Rescue.  However there are several new gamemodes: VIP Escort (Drive the VIP to an extraction point), VIP Escort On Foot (Lead the VIP to the extraction point on a close quarters map on foot), Team Death Match (10 second respawn close quarters combat), and the newer hostage rescue which is the one I mentioned above (Capture hostages as a Terrorist for a few rounds and then contain them or capture hostages from the Terrorists and attack as a COunter-Terrorist).  This game has many features the old Counter-Strike did not have like: RPGs and M320 Grenade Launchers, cars, new loadout and purchasing systems, fast roping down the sides of buildings, levolution when a bomb detonates, new guns, pick up ammo off of a dead teammate or dead enemy, heal your teammates, new knife, new player animations and new NPC animations and AI, the ability to look down and see your legs, better graphics, more video display options and power saving options, perks, kill streaks, attack dogs, character customization, new maps, new voting systems, private server creator and much more!  All in all, this is a very impressive game, all we need are more amped graphics while the current graphics are good and the ability to aim on all weapons since technically this is not Counter-Strike and it helps bring a whole new level of skill to the game.  So in the end, YES! I would recommend this game.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												I would much rather shove a knife up my @ss than play this again.This has got to be one of the worst games ever. Horrible textures, unbalanced weapons, stupid systems, the list goes onFirst off, the game looks like shjt. Literal shjt. I've seen better out of Roblox. One of the things you'll notice is that the weapons are horribly unbalanced. there is very little way your skill can really affect how you perform. After deciding to buy one of these OP guns, i noticed the purchasing system was the worst i've ever seen. You can choose to either buy for 1 day, 7 days, or permanently. And there are options to buy with either in-game points, or real money. REAL MONEY. A lot of items such as crates are only obtainable through purchasing with real moneyThe layout of the shop screens and all that is quite confusing and cluttered. Its hard to get used to where everything is, how to set profiles, and equip items. One thing that i can't get over is the lack of aiming down sights. This isnt an issue in games like CSGO because you can fire accurately by simply standing still. In this, its hard to kill someone across the room with most guns, as well as the fact that its relatively fast paced, so you cant stand still. Controls are a little strange, the Q and E keys can be used to lean, but are awkward and unnatural to press, cause you cant have your finger on W at the same time. Pressing Q and E at the same time enables blind fire mode, letting you shoot from behind cover without exposing yourself. And to top it all off, I had numerous connection issues, causing me to get kicked out of the game.This game recieves -6 Golden Bananas+ out of Shigeru Miyamoto1/10 wouldn't bang    -IGN22/500,000 super shjtty    -Destructoid0/5 Massively ♥♥♥♥y and Bad    -Me

content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
												Are you in a multiplayer rut?  Has it been more then 100 hours since you last played something different?Tactical Intervention breaks the mundane cycle of only playing one title allowing you to spend your first 30-60 minutes setting up individual character slots with weapons/ammo/gear.  You then join a game and are immediately faced with the realization that all your weapons in every slot have been restricted by the server.So?!  This is how it goes down:  You hit that submit button and knock every level-16 badass unconscious with the single pistol the server so thoughtfully allowed you to have.  Will open review again pending the next 100 hours in Left4Dead2.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2014
												The game plays relatively smoothly and seamlessly, but there are several problems with it.First and foremost, there's the problem with the hit detection and damage counter. When you die, you often see things like "You were hit 2 times for 165 damage. You hit them 12 times for 40 damage." It doesn't take a genius to determine that that's just not feasible. Sometimes, I even "get hit 0 times for 100+ damage", proving that there is something seriously wrong with core mechanics in the combat system.Second of all, the weapon balancing for certain weapons is absolutely broken, especially concerning the AS50 rifle and the M4 STAR 10. The AS50 not only deals 2.5 times as much damage as the maximum health of a player, it is essentially a substitute for short-range weapons like shotguns, which is highly uncharacteristic of a sniper rifle and frankly ruins the game.Speaking of shotguns, the M4 STAR 10 semiautomatic shotgun is also extremely overpowered. Its one-shot capability and blistering rate of fire make it virtually unbeatable. Anyone who uses either of these guns frankly takes all the fun out of everyone else's experience.The game has potential, but the inherent flaws in the combat system and overpowered weapons completely ruin the game.
